en: Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, called to be an apostle, separated unto the gospel of God,
hmr: Paula, Isu Krista suok, tirko ni dinga ko, Pathien Chanchin Ṭha hril dinga ṭhethlâka um lekhathawn:

en: which he promised afore through his prophets in the holy scriptures,
hmr: Chu Chanchin Ṭha chu Pa- thienin inhmata a lekha inthieng- haia zâwlneihai baua a ilo tiem tah, a Naupa ei Lalpa Isu Krista thu chu a nih.

en: concerning his Son, who was born of the seed of David according to the flesh,
hmr: Tisa tienga chun ama chu David suona insieng a na,

en: who was declared to be the Son of God with power, according to the spirit of holiness, by the resurrection from the dead; even Jesus Christ our Lord,
hmr: inthiengna Thlarau tieng thua ruok chun mithi laia inthawka a thonâwkna chun Pathien Nau a ni zie thilthawtheina nasatakin ân hriettir a;

en: through whom we received grace and apostleship, unto obedience of faith among all the nations, for his name’s sake;
hmr: A hming leia hnam tin laia mi ringna thu chu inzâwmtir dingin; ama zâra chun lunginsietna le tirko nina chu kan chang tah a;

en: among whom are ye also, called to be Jesus Christ’s:
hmr: nangni khawm chuonghai lai chun Isu Krista ta ni dinga ko chu in nih.

en: to all that are in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
hmr: Rom khuoa Pathien idittakhai, mi inthieng ni dinga kohai po po kuomah; Pathien ei Pa le Lalpa Isu Kristaa inthawka lunginsietna le inremna in kuomah um raw se.

en: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all, that your faith is proclaimed throughout the whole world.
hmr: A hmasatakin, khawvêl po poah in ringna thu ân thang leiin in rênga chunga ka lâwm thu, Isu Krista zârah ka Pathien kuomah ka hril a nih.

en: For God is my witness, whom I serve in my spirit in the gospel of his Son, how unceasingly I make mention of you, always in my prayers
hmr: A Naupa Chanchin Ṭha hrila ka thlaraua a rawng ka ibâwl Pathien chu a mi hrepuitu a nih; ka ṭawngṭainahaia chun maloin in hminghai ka lam rawp a.

en: making request, if by any means now at length I may be prospered by the will of God to come unto you.
hmr: Tu bêk hin in kuoma ka hung theina dingin Pathien remti ang anga, hung inzinna remchâng ka nei tei tei theina dingin ka hni rawp hlak.

en: For I long to see you, that I may impart unto you some spiritual gift, to the end ye may be established;
hmr: In detna dinga Thlarau tieng thilpêk iengamanih ka pêk theina ding cheuin hmu cheu kân hâwk hle a nih.

en: that is, that I with you may be comforted in you, each of us by the other’s faith, both yours and mine.
hmr: Chu chu in ringna le keia ringnain ei inthlamuon tuo theina dingin ka tina a nih.

en: And I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that oftentimes I purposed to come unto you (and was hindered hitherto), that I might have some fruit in you also, even as in the rest of the Gentiles.
hmr: Unauhai, Jentail danghai laia kân rimna ra ka hmu ta ang bawkin, nangni lai khawm a ra ka hmu theina dingin, in kuoma hung vawi tamtak ka tum tah ti in hriet naw ka nuom nawh; nisienlakhawm, kha hma po khan chu dangin ka um rawp a.

en: I am debtor both to Greeks and to Barbarians, both to the wise and to the foolish.
hmr: Grik mihai le hnamchawmhai kuomah bat ka nei, mi var le mi invêthai kuoma khawm.

en: So, as much as in me is, I am ready to preach the gospel to you also that are in Rome.
hmr: Chuongchun, nangni Rom khuoa mihai kuoma khawm Chan- chin Ṭha ka theitâwpa hril dingin inzosa zinga um ka nih.

en: For I am not ashamed of the gospel: for it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth; to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.
hmr: Chanchin Ṭha chu kân zâpui si nawh a, tûkhawm a awihai po ta dinga sandamna dinga Pathien thilthawtheina a ni sih a; a phutin Juda mi ta dingin, chun, Grik mihai ta ding khawmin a hung nih.

en: For therein is revealed a righteousness of God from faith unto faith: as it is written, But the righteous shall live by faith.
hmr: Chutaka chun awi nâwkzuolna dingin, ringnain Pathien felzie chu a hung inlang a, “Ringna leia mifel chu hring a tih” tia ziek ang khan.

en: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hinder the truth in unrighteousness;
hmr: Thutak fel nawtaka dangtuhai Pathien ngaisak nawna le fel nawna po po chunga chun vâna inthawkin Pathien lungsen a hung inlang a nih.

en: because that which is known of God is manifest in them; for God manifested it unto them.
hmr: Pathienin ân hriettir ta leiin, Pathien chanchin hriet dinghai chu an lungrilah inhriettirin a um sih a.

en: For the invisible things of him since the creation of the world are clearly seen, being perceived through the things that are made, even his everlasting power and divinity; that they may be without excuse:
hmr: Amaa mizie hmu thei lo hai, a chatuon thilthawtheina le a Pathien nizie chu, leihnuoi siem tîra inthawkin chiengtaka hmuin a um a, thilsiema chun ân lang a nih; chuleichun, suonlam ding hrim an nei nawh;

en: because that, knowing God, they glorified him not as God, neither gave thanks; but became vain in their reasonings, and their senseless heart was darkened.
hmr: Pathien hre zing siin Pathien angin an chawimawi nawh a, lâwmthu khawm an hril bawk si nawh. Teplo mei mei an ngaituo lem tah a, an lungril invêt chu a hung inthim tah a.

en: Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,
hmr: Vara inngaiin invêt an lo ni tah a,

en: and changed the glory of the incorruptible God for the likeness of an image of corruptible man, and of birds, and four-footed beasts, and creeping things.
hmr: Pathien thi thei lo ropuina chu, mihriem thi thei dâm le vatehai dâm, sapheimanli le thilhringhai lim angah an inchangtir tah a.

en: Wherefore God gave them up in the lusts of their hearts unto uncleanness, that their bodies should be dishonored among themselves:
hmr: Chuleichun, an taksa inzakum- taka insiem tuo dingin an lungril inhâwk anga pawrchêtaka um phalin Pathienin a nghatsan tah a.

en: for that they exchanged the truth of God for a lie, and worshipped and served the creature rather than the Creator, who is blessed for ever. Amen.
hmr: Pathien thutak chu khêla inchangtirin, a siemtu biek nêkin a isiemhai chu bein an rawng an bâwl ta lem sih a. A siemtu chu kumkhuoa inpâk tlâk a nih! Amen.

en: For this cause God gave them up unto vile passions: for their women changed the natural use into that which is against nature:
hmr: Chuleichun, Pathienin inzak- umtaka hur phalin a nghatsan a; an nuhmeihai rau khawma an um dân insiengpui chu dân naw anga um dingin an insuk danglam sih a;

en: and likewise also the men, leaving the natural use of the woman, burned in their lust one toward another, men with men working unseemliness, and receiving in themselves that recompense of their error which was due.
hmr: pasalhai khawm nuhmei le inhmang dân pângngai chu bânsana hurin, ân hnarin an inhnar tuoh a; pasal le pasal khawm ṭha nawtakin an inthawh a, an suol man hmu ding chu anni le annia chun an hmuh a.

en: And even as they refused to have God in their knowledge, God gave them up unto a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not fitting;
hmr: Chun, Pathien hriet an nuom naw leiin, thil mawi naw tak tak thaw dinga a dit naw zâwng lungril nei phalin Pathienin a nghatsan tah a;

en: being filled with all unrighteousness, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, strife, deceit, malignity; whisperers,
hmr: chuongchun, rîtlona tinrêng dâm, suolna tinrêng dâm, inhnarna tinrêng dâm, lungril ṭhat nawna tinrêng dâmin an hung sip tah a; îtsîkna dâm, tuolthatna dâm, inhalna dâm, inhlêmna dâm, lungril setak dâma sip an na; inberu hmanghai,

en: backbiters, hateful to God, insolent, haughty, boastful, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,
hmr: mi rêl hmanghai, Pathien theida zâwnghai, intiveihai, chapo- hai, mi uonghai, thil suol thar suksuoktuhai, nu le pa thu awi lohai,

en: without understanding, covenant-breakers, without natural affection, unmerciful:
hmr: hrietthiemna bo, thu tiem bawsietuhai, piengpui lunginsietna nei naw mihai, lunginsietna nei naw mihai an lo ni tah a;

en: who, knowing the ordinance of God, that they that practise such things are worthy of death, not only do the same, but also consent with them that practise them.
hmr: chuong ang thawtuhai chu thi tlâk an nih, ti Pathien iruot chu hre zing siin, anni chau khawma thaw loin, mi dang a thawhai chunga khawm chun an lâwm bawk a.

en: Brethren, my heart’s desire and my supplication to God is for them, that they may be saved.
hmr: Unauhai, ka lung nuom zâwng le, anni ta dinga Pathien kuoma ka ṭawngṭaina san tak hi, sandam an hung ni theina ding a nih.

en: For I bear them witness that they have a zeal for God, but not according to knowledge.
hmr: Pathien tieng ṭhahnem an ngai ti ka hrietpui a nih, hrietna indiktak leia ṭhahnemngaina ruok chu a ni nawh.

en: For being ignorant of God’s righteousness, and seeking to establish their own, they did not subject themselves to the righteousness of God.
hmr: Pathien felna hre loin, anni felna sukdet an tum a, Pathien felnaah an inpêk lût si nawh.

en: For Christ is the end of the law unto righteousness to every one that believeth.
hmr: Krista chu ama ringhai po ta dingin felna an hmu theina dinga Dân suktâwpna a ni sih a.

en: For Moses writeth that the man that doeth the righteousness which is of the law shall live thereby.
hmr: Mosie chun, “Mi Dâna felna zâwm chu, chu felna zâra chun hring a tih,” tiin a ziek a.

en: But the righteousness which is of faith saith thus, Say not in thy heart, Who shall ascend into heaven? (that is, to bring Christ down:)
hmr: Ringnaa felna ruok chun, hieng hin a hril, “In lungrilin, ‘Tu am vânah lâwn a ta?’ (chu chu Krista hung ṭhuoi thla ding tina a nih)

en: or, Who shall descend into the abyss? (that is, to bring Christ up from the dead.)
hmr: amanih, ‘Tu am vânsamah zu ṭum a ta?’ (chu chu mithi laia inthawka Krista zu ṭhuoi suok ding tina a nih) ti naw ro,” tiin.

en: But what saith it? The word is nigh thee, in thy mouth, and in thy heart: that is, the word of faith, which we preach:
hmr: Anleh, ieng am a hril a? “Thu chun a hnai che, i bau le i lungrila khawm a um,” tiin a hril a nih. Chu chu ringna thu ei hril hlak hi a nih:

en: because if thou shalt confess with thy mouth Jesus as Lord, and shalt believe in thy heart that God raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved:
hmr: I bauin, “Isu chu Lalpa a nih” tia i ṭan a, mithi laia inthawkin Pathienin a keitho ti i lungrila i ring phawt chun sandamin um i tih.

en: for with the heart man believeth unto righteousness; and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation.
hmr: Mihaiin an lungrilin an ring a, felna an hmu hlak, bauin an ṭan a, sandamna an hmu bawk hlak a nih.

en: For the scripture saith, Whosoever believeth on him shall not be put to shame.
hmr: Pathien Lekha Thuin, “Tû- khawm ama ring taphawt chu muolpho naw ni hai,” a ti a nih.

en: For there is no distinction between Jew and Greek: for the same Lord is Lord of all, and is rich unto all that call upon him:
hmr: Juda le Grik mihai chu ienga khawm an danglam chuong si nawh a. Lalpa pakhat an rênga chunga Lalpa a nih; ama lamtuhai po chunga chun ṭhatna a hau sih a.

en: for, Whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.
hmr: “Tukhawm Lalpa hming lam taphawt chu sandamin um an tih,” a ti a nih.

en: How then shall they call on him in whom they have not believed? and how shall they believe in him whom they have not heard? and how shall they hear without a preacher?
hmr: Anleh, an awi naw chu iengtin am lam an ta? A thu an hriet naw chu iengtin am awi an ta? Thuhriltu um loin iengtin am hrieng an ta?

en: and how shall they preach, except they be sent? even as it is written, How beautiful are the feet of them that bring glad tidings of good things!
hmr: Tir an ni naw chun iengtin am thu hril an ta? “Thil ṭha chanchin lâwmum intluntuhai ke chu a va mawi de!” tia ziek ang khan.

en: But they did not all hearken to the glad tidings. For Isaiah saith, Lord, who hath believed our report?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Chanchin Ṭha chu an rêng chun an ring vawng nawh. Isaiin, “Lalpa, kan thu hril tuin am a ring a?” a ti sih a.

en: So belief cometh of hearing, and hearing by the word of Christ.
hmr: Chuongchun, ringna chu hrietna leiin a hung um hlaka; chun, hrietna chu Isu Krista leiin a hung um.

en: But I say, Did they not hear? Yea, verily, Their sound went out into all the earth, And their words unto the ends of the world.
hmr: Anleh, an nain an hriet naw am a nih? Hreh e le! “An ri chu ram tinah ân thang a, An thu chu kâwlkawdawng chenin ân thang suok tah.”

en: But I say, Did Israel not know? First Moses saith, I will provoke you to jealousy with that which is no nation, With a nation void of understanding will I anger you.
hmr: Anleh, Israel mihaiin an hriet naw am a nih? “Chia hril khawp lohai chu hmangin, Inthîktir ka ti cheu a, Hnam invêthai chu hmangin, Suklungsen ka ti cheu,” tiin Mosiein a hril hmasatak a.

en: And Isaiah is very bold, and saith, I was found of them that sought me not; I became manifest unto them that asked not of me.
hmr: Chun, Isaiin huoitakin, “A mi zawng nawhai hmuin ka um a, A mi lam nawhai kuomah inhriettirin ka um a,” a tih a.

en: But as to Israel he saith, All the day long did I spread out my hands unto a disobedient and gainsaying people.
hmr: Amiruokchu, Israelhai thua chun, “Mi timawhai le sêlhrâthai ta dingin, Sûnnithlâkin ka bânhai ka phar hlak kha,” a tih a.

en: I say then, Did God cast off his people? God forbid. For I also am an Israelite, of the seed of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.
hmr: Anleh, Pathienin a mihai chu a pei thlâk am a nih? Teu lo e a! Kei khawm Israel mi, Abraham thla, Benjamin hnam ka ni sih a.

en: God did not cast off his people which he foreknew. Or know ye not what the scripture saith of Elijah? how he pleadeth with God against Israel:
hmr: Pathienin mi a ihriet lâwkhai chu a pei thlâk nawh. Pathien Lekha Thu chun Elija, thu a hril hi in hriet naw am a nih? Ama chun Israelhai chungthu Pathien kuomah ân tlun a;

en: Lord, they have killed thy prophets, they have digged down thine altars; and I am left alone, and they seek my life.
hmr: “Lalpa, i zâwlneihai an sukhlum a, I mâichâmhai an cho chim a, Keia khât chauin ka la um a, Kei khawm mi sukhlum an tum a nih,” a ti hi.

en: But what saith the answer of God unto him? I have left for myself seven thousand men, who have not bowed the knee to Baal.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pathienin ieng- tin am a dawn a? “Baal hmaa la dingṭhaṭhuon ngai naw, mi sâng sari keia tâ dingin ka la hla zing a nih,” tiin a dawn a.

en: Even so then at this present time also there is a remnant according to the election of grace.
hmr: Chuong ang bawkin, tulai khawm hin lunginsietnaa thlang ang peiin pei thlâk mahla chu an la um.

en: But if it is by grace, it is no more of works: otherwise grace is no more grace.
hmr: Lunginsietna lei a ni chun thilthaw lei ni ta naw ni; chuong a ni naw chun lunginsietna hi lungin- sietna ni ta naw ni.

en: What then? That which Israel seeketh for, that he obtained not; but the election obtained it, and the rest were hardened:
hmr: Iengtin am ni tâng a ti leh? Israel mihai chun an zawng chu an hmu nawh a; Thlanghai ruok chun an hmuh a, a danghai po po chu an ngawng zo tah a.

en: according as it is written, God gave them a spirit of stupor, eyes that they should not see, and ears that they should not hear, unto this very day.
hmr: “Pathienin vawisûn chen hin inlusukna thlarau a pêk a, hmu thei nawna mithai le, hriet thei nawna nâhai dâm le chun,” tia ziek ang khan.

en: And David saith, Let their table be made a snare, and a trap, And a stumblingblock, and a recompense unto them:
hmr: Chun, David chun, “An dâwkân chu an ta dingin châng le bil le, Tlûkna le, thungna lo ni raw se;

en: Let their eyes be darkened, that they may not see, And bow thou down their back always.
hmr: An hmu thei nawna dingin an mithai hung inthim raw se; Nangin an ruongzâng inkûntir rawp rawh,” a tih a.

en: I say then, Did they stumble that they might fall? God forbid: but by their fall salvation is come unto the Gentiles, to provoke them to jealousy.
hmr: Anleh, an tlûk chu an tlûk sawngna ding am a nih? Teu lo e a! An tlûk leiin Jentailhai kuoma chun sandamna a hung tlung ta lem a nih; Israel mihai inthîktirna dingin.

en: Now if their fall is the riches of the world, and their loss the riches of the Gentiles; how much more their fulness?
hmr: Chuongchun, an tlûkna hman khawvêl sukhausakna a na, an kiemna hman Jentailhai sukhausak- na a ni chun, an famkimna chu an hausakna a va ni nasa zuol ding de!

en: But I speak to you that are Gentiles. Inasmuch then as I am an apostle of Gentiles, I glorify my ministry;
hmr: Chuongchun, nangni Jentailhai kuomah ka hril a nih. Kei Jentailhai tirko ka ni leiin, ka rawngbâwlna sin hi ka chawimawi a nih;

en: if by any means I may provoke to jealousy them that are my flesh, and may save some of them.
hmr: ka chipuihai kân thîktir hrâm theina ding le, anni laia mi ṭhenkhat ka sandam theina dingin.

en: For if the casting away of them is the reconciling of the world, what shall the receiving of them be, but life from the dead?
hmr: Anni pei thlâkna hman khawvêl ta dinga inrem nâwkna a ni chun, anni lâwm nâwkna ding chu, thinaa inthawka hring nâwkna naw chu ieng am ning a ta?

en: And if the firstfruit is holy, so is the lump: and if the root is holy, so are the branches.
hmr: Chun, bei tlang ât thlâk hmasa- tak chu inhlân thieng a ni chun a pumin chuong ang bawk chu a nih. A zung ân thieng chun a kâuhai khawm chuong ang bawk chu a nih.

en: But if some of the branches were broken off, and thou, being a wild olive, wast grafted in among them, and didst become partaker with them of the root of the fatness of the olive tree;
hmr: Chun, a kâu a ṭhen chu suk- tlieka umin, nang oliv puopa ni si, anni laia zawma umin, oliv thing hringna ṭha în ṭawmpui ve a ni chun,

en: glory not over the branches: but if thou gloriest, it is not thou that bearest the root, but the root thee.
hmr: a kâu danghai lai chun insuong naw rawh. Insuong la khawm, nang a zung châwmtu i ni nawh a, a zung chu nang a châwmtu che a ni lem a nih.

en: Thou wilt say then, Branches were broken off, that I might be grafted in.
hmr: Chun, nangin, “Zawma ka um theina dingin a kâuhai chu suktliekin a um annâwm?” tîng i tih.

en: Well; by their unbelief they were broken off, and thou standest by thy faith. Be not highminded, but fear:
hmr: Anih, an ring nawna leiin suk- tliekin an um a, nang i ringna leiin i ngîr a nih.

en: for if God spared not the natural branches, neither will he spare thee.
hmr: Chapo naw la, ṭi lem rawh. Pathienin a kâu takhai hman a hla si naw chun nang khawm hla bîk naw ni che.

en: Behold then the goodness and severity of God: toward them that fell, severity; but toward thee, God’s goodness, if thou continue in his goodness: otherwise thou also shalt be cut off.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pathien ṭhatzie le a ṭiumzie chu ngaituo rawh; a tluhai ta ding chun ṭi a um a nih; nanga ta ding ruok chun a ṭha a nih, a ṭhatnaa i um zing chun; chuong a ni naw chun, nang khawm sât thlâkin um vêng i tih.

en: And they also, if they continue not in their unbelief, shall be grafted in: for God is able to graft them in again.
hmr: Chun, anni khawm chu awi loa an um zing naw chun zawmin um an tih; Pathienin anni a zawm nâwk thei sih a.

en: For if thou wast cut out of that which is by nature a wild olive tree, and wast grafted contrary to nature into a good olive tree; how much more shall these, which are the natural branches, be grafted into their own olive tree?
hmr: Nang oliv puopa hrima in- thawka sât thlâk hman, pieng dân naw anga oliv thing ṭhaa zawma i um chun, chuong a kâu tak takhai chu an bulpui, oliv thing pângngaia chun zawm an va ni nasa âwm de!

en: For I would not, brethren, have you ignorant of this mystery, lest ye be wise in your own conceits, that a hardening in part hath befallen Israel, until the fulness of the Gentiles be come in;
hmr: Unauhai, hi thurûk hi in hriet naw ka nuom nghâl si nawh a, chuong naw chun intivar in tih; Jentail famkimna a hung tlung hma chun Israel mi ṭhenkhat chungah ngawngna a hung tlung hri phawt a nih, ti hi.

en: and so all Israel shall be saved: even as it is written, There shall come out of Zion the Deliverer; He shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob:
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel mi po po sandamin um an tih; “Ziona inthawkin Sandamtu chu hung suok a ta, Jakob kuoma Pathien ngaisak nawna sukbo a tih.

en: And this is my covenant unto them, When I shall take away their sins.
hmr: Chu chu an kuoma ka thu thlung ding chu a nih, An suolhai ka lâk hmang pha chun,” tia ziek ang khan.

en: As touching the gospel, they are enemies for your sake: but as touching the election, they are beloved for the fathers’ sake.
hmr: Chanchin Ṭha tieng ngaituo chun nangni leiin hmêlma an nih; Thlang thu tienga ngaituo ruok chun, thlatuhai lei khan dittakhai an nih.

en: For the gifts and the calling of God are not repented of.
hmr: Pathienin a thilthlâwnpêkhaia le a konaa chun a lungril a lêt ngai si nawh a.

en: For as ye in time past were disobedient to God, but now have obtained mercy by their disobedience,
hmr: Inhma khan Pathien thu in awi nawh a, nisienlakhawm, tuhin chu an awi naw leiin lunginsietna in chang sih a;

en: even so have these also now been disobedient, that by the mercy shown to you they also may now obtain mercy.
hmr: Chuong ang bawkin tuhin chu Pathienin a lunginsiet cheu lei hin, lunginsietna chu an hmu ve theina dingin anni khawm chun an awi ve ta naw a ni hi.

en: For God hath shut up all unto disobedience, that he might have mercy upon all.
hmr: Pathienin a lunginsiet vawng theina dingin mi po po awi lonaah a khum ta vawng sih a.

en: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and the knowledge of God! how unsearchable are his judgments, and his ways past tracing out!
hmr: Pathien hausakzie, a varna le hrietna hauzie chu a vân thûk de! A rorêlnahai chu hriet thei ruol le, a lampuihai chu sui thei ruol a va ni naw de!

en: For who hath known the mind of the Lord? or who hath been his counsellor?
hmr: Lalpa lungril chu tuin am a hriet a? A remruotpêktua khawm tu am a ṭhang tah a?

en: or who hath first given to him, and it shall be recompensed unto him again?
hmr: A thung nâwk dingin tuin am a kuomah thil pe hmasa?

en: For of him, and through him, and unto him, are all things. To him be the glory for ever. Amen.
hmr: Amaa inthawk le ama zâr le, ama ta dinga thil po po a hung um a ni sih a; ama kuoma chun chatuonin ropuina chu um raw se. Amen.

en: I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, to present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to God, which is your spiritual service.
hmr: Chuongchun, unauhai, Pa- thien lunginsietna lei hin in- thâwina hring le inthieng le Pathien ilâwmtlâk ni dingin, in taksa chu inhlân dingin ka ngên cheu a nih; chu chu in rawngbâwlna âwm hrim a nih.

en: And be not fashioned according to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what is the good and acceptable and perfect will of God.
hmr: Hi khawvêl dân ang hin um naw unla, Pathien dit zâwng a ṭha le lâwmtlâk le ṭha famkim chu in hriet chieng theina dingin, in lungril a thara umin, hung danglam lem ta ro khai.

en: For I say, through the grace that was given me, to every man that is among you, not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think; but so to think as to think soberly, according as God hath dealt to each man a measure of faith.
hmr: Pathienin a mi pêk lunginsietna lei hin in laia tukhawmin in ingaihlu tâwk bâka inngaihlu loin, Pathienin mi tin kuoma ringna huntâwk a pêk ang peiin, feltaka ngaituo lem dingin ka ti seng cheu a nih.

en: For even as we have many members in one body, and all the members have not the same office:
hmr: Taksa pumkhatah pêng tamtak ei nei a, a pêng po po sinthaw chu an âng vawng nawh a;

en: so we, who are many, are one body in Christ, and severally members one of another.
hmr: chuong ang bawkin, eini tamtak ni inla khawm Kristaa chun taksa pumkhat ei na, amal malin inpêng tuo seng ei nih.

en: And having gifts differing according to the grace that was given to us, whether prophecy, let us prophesy according to the proportion of our faith;
hmr: Lunginsietna ei kuoma pêk ang sengin thilthlâwnpêk hi a tum tum ei nei seng a, thu hril ding a ni chun, ei ringna phutâwk peiin hril ei tiu;

en: or ministry, let us give ourselves to our ministry; or he that teacheth, to his teaching;
hmr: rawngbâwl ding a ni chun ei rawngbâwlnaa chun inpe tlat ei tiu, inchûktirtu khawmin inchûktir tlat raw se;

en: or he that exhorteth, to his exhorting: he that giveth, let him do it with liberality; he that ruleth, with diligence; he that showeth mercy, with cheerfulness.
hmr: mi infuitu khawma infui raw se; thil petu khawmin inro loin pe raw se, rorêltu chun taimatakin ro rêl raw se; mi lunginsiettu khawmin lâwmtakin lunginsiet raw se.

en: Let love be without hypocrisy. Abhor that which is evil; cleave to that which is good.
hmr: Hmangaina chu vervêkna ṭhang loin ni raw se. Suol tieng chu theida unla, ṭha tieng chu pawm tlat ro.

en: In love of the brethren be tenderly affectioned one to another; in honor preferring one another;
hmr: Unauhai hmangai kawnga chun inhmangai takin inlainat tuo seng ro; chawimawi kawnga chun inditsak tuo seng ro;

en: in diligence not slothful; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord;
hmr: taimâk kawnga chun thaboin um naw ro; thlarau kawnga chun ṭhahnem ngai unla, Lalpa rawng bâwl unla,

en: rejoicing in hope; patient in tribulation; continuing stedfastly in prayer;
hmr: beiseina kawnga chun, lâwm unla; rinum tuor kawnga chun tuor- sel unla, ṭawngṭaina kawnga chun ṭawngṭai fan fan ro.

en: communicating to the necessities of the saints; given to hospitality.
hmr: Mi inthienghai tlâksamnaa chun sawmdâwl unla, mikhuolhai lâwm hlak mi ni ro.

en: Bless them that persecute you; bless, and curse not.
hmr: A suknawmnatuhai cheu chu malsâwmpêk unla, ṭawngsie chu in phur naw ro.

en: Rejoice with them that rejoice; weep with them that weep.
hmr: Lâwmhai chu lâwmpui unla, ṭaphai chu ṭappui ro.

en: Be of the same mind one toward another. Set not your mind on high things, but condescend to things that are lowly. Be not wise in your own conceits.
hmr: Ngaituo hmunkhatin um tuo seng unla, inngaituo sâng taluo naw unla, mi chînhai inruolpui lem ro. Intivar naw ro.

en: Render to no man evil for evil. Take thought for things honorable in the sight of all men.
hmr: Tu suol khawm suolin thung naw ro, mi po po ngaia thil mawi chu ngaituo lâwk ro.

en: If it be possible, as much as in you lieth, be at peace with all men.
hmr: A thei phawt chun nangni tieng bêk mi po po le inremin um ro.

en: Avenge not yourselves, beloved, but give place unto the wrath of God: for it is written, Vengeance belongeth unto me; I will recompense, saith the Lord.
hmr: Dittakhai, in phuba la naw unla, Pathien lunginsenna inkien lem ro, “phuba hrim hrim keia lâk ding a nih, keiin thung ka tih, Lalpain a tih,” ti ziek a ni sih a.

en: But if thine enemy hunger, feed him; if he thirst, give him to drink: for in so doing thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head.
hmr: Chuleiin, i hmêlma a phîng a ṭâm chun fâk ding pe la, a dang a châr chun dâwn ding pe rawh; chuong anga i thaw chun a lu chunga meiling i sie khâwl nîng a tih.

en: Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.
hmr: Suol ihnein um naw la, ṭhatnain suol chu hne lem rawh.

en: Let every soul be in subjection to the higher powers: for there is no power but of God; and the powers that be are ordained of God.
hmr: Mi tin an chunga rorêltuhai thu thuin um raw se. Pathien thu loin tukhawm rorêltu an um ngai si nawh a; rorêltua umhai hi Pathien iruot an nih.

en: Therefore he that resisteth the power, withstandeth the ordinance of God: and they that withstand shall receive to themselves judgment.
hmr: Chuleiin, tûkhawm rorêltu kal chu Pathien iruot kal a nih; a kaltuhai chun anni chungah rorêlna hmûng an tih.

en: For rulers are not a terror to the good work, but to the evil. And wouldest thou have no fear of the power? do that which is good, and thou shalt have praise from the same:
hmr: Rorêltuhai chu thil ṭha thaw- tuhai ta ding chun ṭium an ni nawh a, thil ṭha naw thawtuhai ta ding ruok chun ṭium an nih. Anleh, rorêltu ṭi loa um i nuom am? Thil ṭha thâw la, a înpâk hlâwng i tih;

en: for he is a minister of God to thee for good. But if thou do that which is evil, be afraid; for he beareth not the sword in vain: for he is a minister of God, an avenger for wrath to him that doeth evil.
hmr: ama chu i ṭhatna dinga Pathien rawngbâwltu a ni sih a. Nisien- lakhawm, thil suol i thaw chun ṭi rawh, kâwlhnâm chu a chawi mei mei si nawh a; ama chu Pathien rawng- bâwltu, thil suksuoltuhai chunga lunginsenna phuba latu a ni sih a.

en: Wherefore ye must needs be in subjection, not only because of the wrath, but also for conscience’ sake.
hmr: Chuleiin, lunginsenna ṭi lei chau ni loin, i sie le ṭha hrietna lei khawmin rorêltu thu thuin i um ding a ni hrim a nih.

en: For for this cause ye pay tribute also; for they are ministers of God’s service, attending continually upon this very thing.
hmr: Hi lei hin annâwm sie khawm in chawi hlak; chuong ang thil ngei thaw fan fan dinga Pathien rawng- bâwltuhai an ni sih a.

en: Render to all their dues: tribute to whom tribute is due; custom to whom custom; fear to whom fear; honor to whom honor.
hmr: Mi po po kuomah pêk ding taphawt chu pe ro; leiman pêkna ding kuoma chun leiman pe unla, sie chawina ding kuoma chun sie chawi unla, ṭi ding chu ṭi unla, inza ding chu inza ro.

en: Owe no man anything, save to love one another: for he that loveth his neighbor hath fulfilled the law.
hmr: Inhmangai tuona ngawt naw chu tû iengkhawm bat naw ro; mâni mihriempui hmangaitu chun dân chu a zâwm famkim ta sih a.

en: For this, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not kill, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not covet, and if there be any other commandment, it is summed up in this word, namely, Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.
hmr: Hieng, “Uire naw, tuol that naw, inru naw, inhnar naw,” ti le thupêk danghai hrim hrim hi, “Nangma în hmangai angin i vênghai i hmangai ding a nih,” ti hin a khai khâwm vawng a nih.

en: Love worketh no ill to his neighbor: love therefore is the fulfilment of the law.
hmr: Hmangainain vênghai a suk- khawhlo ngai nawh a, chuleiin hmangaina hi dân hraw famkimna a nih.

en: And this, knowing the season, that already it is time for you to awake out of sleep: for now is salvation nearer to us than when we first believed.
hmr: Tulai thil umzie in hriet lei le, inhai ta dingin innaa inthawkin ṭhanghar a hun ta takzet ti in hriet leiin chu chu ka hril a nih; tuhin chu ei awi phut lai nêk khan chu ei sandamna chu a hnai lem ta sih a.

en: The night is far spent, and the day is at hand: let us therefore cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armor of light.
hmr: Zân hi a bo vâng vâng tah a, khuo a var ding a ni tah, chuleiin inthimna thilthawhai chu pei inla, var thuomin inthuom ei tiu khai.

en: Let us walk becomingly, as in the day; not in revelling and drunkenness, not in chambering and wantonness, not in strife and jealousy.
hmr: Sûna um angin mawitakin um ei tiu, zu dâwn buoi le zu inruia um loin, hur le indit hmanga um loin, insuol le inîtthîka um loin,

en: But put ye on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make not provision for the flesh, to fulfil the lusts thereof.
hmr: Lalpa Isu Krista chun inthuom lem unla, in tisa inhâwkna puitlin dingin iengkhawm insiem naw ro.

en: But him that is weak in faith receive ye, yet not for decision of scruples.
hmr: Chun, ringnaa hrât naw mi chu, a ringhlana sawisêl loin, lâwm lem ro.

en: One man hath faith to eat all things: but he that is weak eateth herbs.
hmr: Mi pakhatin iengkim fa theiin ân ring a, mi hrât naw ruok chun thlai chau a fâk hlak.

en: Let not him that eateth set at nought him that eateth not; and let not him that eateth not judge him that eateth: for God hath received him.
hmr: Iengkim fa mi chun a fa naw chu hmusit naw raw se; a fa naw khawm chun a fatu chu sawisêl naw raw se; Pathienin ama chu a lâwm tah annâwm.

en: Who art thou that judgest the servant of another? to his own lord he standeth or falleth. Yea, he shall be made to stand; for the Lord hath power to make him stand.
hmr: Mi dang siehlaw sawisêltu chu tu am i ni leh? a ngîr le a tlûk chu ama hotupa ta ding a nih. Nisienlakhawm, ama chu inngirtirin um a tih, Lalpa chun ân ngîrtir thei sih a.

en: One man esteemeth one day above another: another esteemeth every day alike. Let each man be fully assured in his own mind.
hmr: Mi pakhatin ni khat hi ni dang nêkin a ngaihlu bîk hlak a, mi dangin ni po po chu inang sengin a ngai hlak a nih. Mi tin mani lungrilah inhre chieng raw se.

en: He that regardeth the day, regardeth it unto the Lord: and he that eateth, eateth unto the Lord, for he giveth God thanks; and he that eateth not, unto the Lord he eateth not, and giveth God thanks.
hmr: Ni insertu chun, Lalpa chawi- mawina dingin ân ser hlak a na. Iengkim fatu chun, Pathien kuomah lâwm thu a hril a, Lalpa chawi- mawina dingin a fâk hlak a nih; a fa nawtu khawm chun, Pathien kuomah lâwm thu a hril a, Pathien chawimawina dingin a fâk naw hlak a nih.

en: For none of us liveth to himself, and none dieth to himself.
hmr: Tûkhawm mâni ta dinga hring ei ni nawh a, tûkhawm mâni ta dinga thi ei ni bawk nawh.

en: For whether we live, we live unto the Lord; or whether we die, we die unto the Lord: whether we live therefore, or die, we are the Lord’s.
hmr: Ei hring chun Lalpa ta dingin ei hring a, ei thi khawmin Lalpa ta dingin ei thi a ni sih a; chuleiin, ei hring khawmin ei thi khawmin Lalpa ta ei nih.

en: For to this end Christ died and lived again, that he might be Lord of both the dead and the living.
hmr: Krista thina le a hung hring nâwkna san chu mi dam le mi thi Lalpa a ni theina hi a ni sih a.

en: But thou, why dost thou judge thy brother? or thou again, why dost thou set at nought thy brother? for we shall all stand before the judgment-seat of God.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, nangin ieng dinga i unau i sawisêl am a na? annawleh, nangin ieng dinga i unau i hmusit am a na? Pathien rorêlna ṭhungpha hmaah ei rêngin ei la ngîr ding a ni sih a.

en: For it is written, As I live, saith the Lord, to me every knee shall bow, And every tongue shall confess to God.
hmr: “Lalpa chun, ‘Mi tinrêng Ka hmaah kûn an ta, Lei tinrêng khawm Pathien kuomah inphuong an tih,’ Tiin ṭawng kân khâm a nih,” a tih a, ti ziek ang khan.

en: So then each one of us shall give account of himself to God.
hmr: Chuongchun, ei rêngin Pathien kuomah mâni chanchin ei hril seng ding a nih.

en: Let us not therefore judge one another any more: but judge ye this rather, that no man put a stumblingblock in his brother’s way, or an occasion of falling.
hmr: Chuleiin, insawisêl tâwl ta nâwm ei niu khai; tûkhawmin mâni unau kalna amanih tlûkna amanih siem naw tum lem seng ro.

en: I know, and am persuaded in the Lord Jesus, that nothing is unclean of itself: save that to him who accounteth anything to be unclean, to him it is unclean.
hmr: Ama le ama ngawt chun ân thieng naw iengkhawm a um nawh ti Lalpa Isua chun ka hriet hle a nih, thil inthieng loa ngaitu ta ding chun, ama ta ding chun ân thieng naw a nih.

en: For if because of meat thy brother is grieved, thou walkest no longer in love. Destroy not with thy meat him for whom Christ died.
hmr: I thil fâk leia i unau lungril a na chun, hmangai dân kawng chu i hraw ta nâw a nih. A thi ai Kristain a thipêk chu i thil fâkin sukbo naw rawh.

en: Let not then your good be evil spoken of:
hmr: Chuongchun, in ta dinga ṭhatna chu suola hrilin um naw raw se;

en: for the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking, but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit.
hmr: Pathien ram chu dâwn le fâk tieng thu a ni si nawh a; felna dâm, inremna dâm, Thlarau Inthienga lâwmna dâm a ni lem ie.

en: For he that herein serveth Christ is well-pleasing to God, and approved of men.
hmr: Tûkhawm, chuong thua Krista rawng bâwl chu, Pathien lâwm zâwng le mihriem inpâkin a um hlak.

en: So then let us follow after things which make for peace, and things whereby we may edify one another.
hmr: Chuongchun, inremna le insuk- sâwt tuona ding thilhai chu hnawt ei tiu.

en: Overthrow not for meat’s sake the work of God. All things indeed are clean; howbeit it is evil for that man who eateth with offence.
hmr: I thil fâk leiin Pathien sinthaw sukse naw. Thil po po chu ân thieng ngei, nisienlakhawm, a thil fâkin mi a sukthlûk chun, a fatu ta dingin suol a nih.

en: It is good not to eat flesh, nor to drink wine, nor to do anything whereby thy brother stumbleth.
hmr: I unau tlûkna ding a ni chun, sa fâk lo dâm, uoin dâwn lo dâm, thil iengkhawm thaw lo a ṭha lem a nih.

en: The faith which thou hast, have thou to thyself before God. Happy is he that judgeth not himself in that which he approveth.
hmr: Ringna i nei chu Pathien hmaah nang chau ihrietin nei el rawh. Mâni ṭha ti kawnga thiemnaw inchangtir naw chu a ham ṭha.

en: But he that doubteth is condemned if he eat, because he eateth not of faith; and whatsoever is not of faith is sin.
hmr: Amiruokchu, ringhlatuin a fâk chun, ringnain a fâk naw leiin thiemnaw a chang a nih; iengkhawm ringna boa thaw chu suol a ni sih a.

en: Now we that are strong ought to bear the infirmities of the weak, and not to please ourselves.
hmr: Chuongchun, eini mi hrâthai hin mâni lâwmna zawng loin mi hrât nawhai hrât nawna ei tuorpui lem ding a nih.

en: Let each one of us please his neighbor for that which is good, unto edifying.
hmr: Mâni vênghai suksâwtna dingin an ṭhatna dingin suklâwm tum seng ei tiu,

en: For Christ also pleased not himself; but, as it is written, The reproaches of them that reproached thee fell upon me.
hmr: Krista khawm chun mâni lâwm- na a zawng si nawh a. “Nangma haltuhai halna che chu keia chungah a tla tah,” ti ziek ang khan a um lem.

en: For whatsoever things were written aforetime were written for our learning, that through patience and through comfort of the scriptures we might have hope.
hmr: Pathien Lekha thua tuorselna le lungmuongna hmua beiseina ei nei theina dingin, inhmaa ziekhai ta- phawt chu eini inchûktirna dinga ziek an ni sih a.

en: Now the God of patience and of comfort grant you to be of the same mind one with another according to Christ Jesus:
hmr: Tuorselna le thlamuongna Pa- thien chun Isu Krista hril angin lungril hmunkhat put dingin inumtir raw se cheu;

en: that with one accord ye may with one mouth glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
hmr: ei Lalpa Isu Krista Pathien le Pa chu, lungril hmunkhat le inthuruola in chawimawi theina dingin.

en: Wherefore receive ye one another, even as Christ also received you, to the glory of God.
hmr: Chuleiin, Krista chun Pathien sukropuina dinga a lâwm cheu ang bawk khan, inlâwm tuo seng ro.

en: For I say that Christ hath been made a minister of the circumcision for the truth of God, that he might confirm the promises given unto the fathers,
hmr: Hi hi ka ihril chu a nih: thlatuhai kuoma thutiemhai chu sukdet ding le Pathien thu ân dik ti inhriettirna dingin Krista chu sertanhai rawng- bâwltuin a hung um a;

en: and that the Gentiles might glorify God for his mercy; as it is written, Therefore will I give praise unto thee among the Gentiles, And sing unto thy name.
hmr: lunginsietna leia Jentailhaiin Pathien an chawimawi theina dingin; “Chuleiin, Jentailhai lai chun, Inpâk ka ti cheh a, I hming chawimawina dingin Hla sak ka tih,” tia ziek ang khan,

en: And again he saith, Rejoice, ye Gentiles, with his people.
hmr: Chun, “Nangni Jentail po pohai, A mihai leh lâwm ro,” a ti nâwk a.

en: And again, Praise the Lord, all ye Gentiles; And let all the peoples praise him.
hmr: Chun, “Nangni Jentail po pohai, Lalpa chu inpâk ro; Mi po po khawmin, Ama chu inpâk raw se,” a ti nâwk a.

en: And again, Isaiah saith, There shall be the root of Jesse, And he that ariseth to rule over the Gentiles; On him shall the Gentiles hope.
hmr: Chun, Isaiin, “Jessai zung zâm chu um a ta, Jentailhai Lala um dingin, A hung suok ding chu um bawk a ta, Ama chu Jentailhai chun beisei phâng an tih,” a ti nâwk bawk a.

en: Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that ye may abound in hope, in the power of the Holy Spirit.
hmr: Thlarau Inthieng thilthawthei- na zâra beiseina in hau theina dingin Beiseina Pathien chun ring leia lâwmna le inremna tinrêngin suksip raw se cheu.

en: And I myself also am persuaded of you, my brethren, that ye yourselves are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish one another.
hmr: Chun, ka unauhai, nangni chungthu chu, nangni ngei ṭhatnain in sip a, varna tinrêng in haua, in inkâwk tuo thei ti kei ngei khawmin indiktakin ka hriet.

en: But I write the more boldly unto you in some measure, as putting you again in remembrance, because of the grace that was given me of God,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, inhriettir nawn ding cheuin khâwlai lai hin amanih huoitakin ka ziek a nih: Pathienin a mi pêk lunginsietna lei hin Jentailhai laia Krista Isu rawng- bâwltu ka nih.

en: that I should be a minister of Christ Jesus unto the Gentiles, ministering the gospel of God, that the offering up of the Gentiles might be made acceptable, being sanctified by the Holy Spirit.
hmr: Jentailhai inhlânna chu, Thla- rau Inthieng sukthienga lâwmtlâk an ni theina dingin Pathien Chanchin Ṭha kawngah thiempu sin ka thaw a nih.

en: I have therefore my glorying in Christ Jesus in things pertaining to God.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pathien tieng kawnga chu, Krista Isua chun suong ding ka nei a nih.

en: For I will not dare to speak of any things save those which Christ wrought through me, for the obedience of the Gentiles, by word and deed,
hmr: Jentailhai inâwitir dingin Kristain thilthaw le thu hrilin keima mi hmanga a thilthawhai chau naw chu iengkhawm hril ngam si naw ning a;

en: in the power of signs and wonders, in the power of the Holy Spirit; so that from Jerusalem, and round about even unto Illyricum, I have fully preached the gospel of Christ;
hmr: inchiknahai, thilmakhai, thil- thawtheinaa le Thlarau Inthieng thilthawtheinaa chun a mi hmang a nih. Chuleiin, Jerusalem le a vêl rama inthawkin Illurikom ram chen- in, Krista Chanchin Ṭha chu ram tinah ka hril kim tah a;

en: yea, making it my aim so to preach the gospel, not where Christ was already named, that I might not build upon another man’s foundation;
hmr: mi dang lungphûm chunga rem ka ni nawna dingin, Chanchin Ṭha chu Krista hming lama a umna ta hmuna chun hril loin,

en: but, as it is written, They shall see, to whom no tidings of him came, And they who have not heard shall understand.
hmr: “A chanchin la hril ngainawnaa mihai chun Hmûng an ta, A la hre ngainawhai chun, Hrieng an tih,” ti ziek ang khan.

en: Wherefore also I was hindered these many times from coming to you:
hmr: Chu lei tak khawm chun a nih, in kuoma hung ka ṭhul rawp hlak chu.

en: but now, having no more any place in these regions, and having these many years a longing to come unto you,
hmr: Tu ruok hin chu hieng ram vêla hin sinthawna hmun hrim ka nei ta nawh, kum tamtak chu in kuoma hung inhâwkin ka um ta bawk a,

en: whensoever I go unto Spain (for I hope to see you in my journey, and to be brought on my way thitherward by you, if first in some measure I shall have been satisfied with your company)—
hmr: Spain rama ka fe phaleh ka fe malama hmu cheu ka beisei sih a, nangni pâwl khawp deu zet lang cheu, chu tienga ka zu fenaa khawm chun nangni rawiin in mi zûn thla ka beisei bawk a nih.

en: but now, I say, I go unto Jerusalem, ministering unto the saints.
hmr: Tu ruok hin chu mi inthienghai rawngbâwl dingin Jerusalemah ka fe phawt ding a nih.

en: For it hath been the good pleasure of Macedonia and Achaia to make a certain contribution for the poor among the saints that are at Jerusalem.
hmr: Makedonia le Akaia rama mihai chun lungâwitakin, Jeru- salema mi inthienghai laia mi rim- sihai ta dingin sum an thawlâwm ta sih a.

en: Yea, it hath been their good pleasure; and their debtors they are. For if the Gentiles have been made partakers of their spiritual things, they owe it to them also to minister unto them in carnal things.
hmr: Anih, lungnitaka an thaw a nih, an kuomah an bat hrim bawk a; Jentailhaiin an thlarau tieng thilah an in ṭâwmpui si chun, khawvêl tieng thilin anni sawmdâwl ve thung a ṭûl hrim a nih.

en: When therefore I have accomplished this, and have sealed to them this fruit, I will go on by you unto Spain.
hmr: Chuleiin, chu chu thaw zoa, a ra khawm feltaka anni kân hmutir zoin nangni sir malamin Spain ramah fe pei ka tih.

en: And I know that, when I come unto you, I shall come in the fulness of the blessing of Christ.
hmr: Chun, in kuoma ka hung pha chun, Krista Chanchin Ṭha mal- sâwmna famkim phurin hung ka tih ti ka hriet a nih.

en: Now I beseech you, brethren, by our Lord Jesus Christ, and by the love of the Spirit, that ye strive together with me in your prayers to God for me;
hmr: Unauhai, tuhin, in mi ṭawngṭai pêknaa chun ṭhahnemngaitaka mi ṭawngṭai pêk dingin Lalpa Isu Krista le Thlarau Inthieng hmangainain ka ngên cheu a nih:

en: that I may be delivered from them that are disobedient in Judæa, and that my ministration which I have for Jerusalem may be acceptable to the saints;
hmr: Judai rama awinawhai laia ka him theina ding le Jerusalem ta dinga sawmdâwlna ka ichawi hi, mi inthienghai lâwm zâwngtak a hung ni theina dingin.

en: that I may come unto you in joy through the will of God, and together with you find rest.
hmr: Pathien remti anga hlimtaka in kuomah ka hung a, ei hlim tlâng theina dingin.

en: Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
hmr: Remna Pathien chu in rênga kuomah um raw se. Amen.

en: I commend unto you Phoebe our sister, who is a servant of the church that is at Cenchreæ:
hmr: Ei farnu Phoibi, Kenkrieia kohran rawngbâwltu hi in- hmêlhriettir cheu ka nuom a nih:

en: that ye receive her in the Lord, worthily of the saints, and that ye assist her in whatsoever matter she may have need of you: for she herself also hath been a helper of many, and of mine own self.
hmr: Lalpa hminga mi inthienghai ang bawka in lo lâwmna ding le, in ṭhangpui a ngaina poa in ṭhangpui theina dingin. Ama ngei khawm hi mi tamtak ṭhangpuitu a lo ni hlak a, kei ngei khawm a m i ṭhangpui a nih.

en: Salute Prisca and Aquila my fellow-workers in Christ Jesus,
hmr: Priskilla le Akuila kha chibai mi bûkpêk ro, Krista Isua ka sin thawpui, ka nun sanhimna dinga, rîng daw ngamhai an nih.

en: who for my life laid down their own necks; unto whom not only I give thanks, but also all the churches of the Gentiles:
hmr: Kei chau ni loin Jentail kohran po poin anni kuoma chun lâwmthu an hril a nih.

en: and salute the church that is in their house. Salute Epænetus my beloved, who is the firstfruits of Asia unto Christ.
hmr: An ina kohran inkhâwmhai chu chibai mi bûkpêk bawk ro. Ka dittak, Epainet, Asia rama Krista awi hmasatak kha chibai mi bûkpêk ro.

en: Salute Mary, who bestowed much labor on you.
hmr: Mari in ta dinga inrimnu kha, chibai mi bûkpêk ro.

en: Salute Andronicus and Junias, my kinsmen, and my fellow-prisoners, who are of note among the apostles, who also have been in Christ before me.
hmr: Ka chipui Andronika le Junia kân tângpuihai kha chibai mi bûkpêk ro; anni chu tirkohai laia hming inthang an na, keia nêka Kristaa um hmasa lem an nih.

en: Salute Ampliatus my beloved in the Lord.
hmr: Amplia Lalpaa ka dittak kha, chibai mi bûkpêk ro.

en: Salute Urbanus our fellow-worker in Christ, and Stachys my beloved.
hmr: Kristaa kan sinthawpui Urbana le ka dittak Sitaku kha chibai mi bûk- pêk ro.

en: Salute Apelles the approved in Christ. Salute them that are of the household of Aristobulus.
hmr: Kristaa mi tak, Apellia kha chi- bai mi bûkpêk ro. Aristobul sûnghai laia mihai kha chibai mi bûkpêk ro.

en: Salute Herodion my kinsman. Salute them of the household of Narcissus, that are in the Lord.
hmr: Ka chipui, Herodion kha chibai mi bûkpêk ro. Narkissa sûnghai laia Lalpaa umhai kha chibai mi bûkpêk ro.

en: Salute Tryphæna and Tryphosa, who labor in the Lord. Salute Persis the beloved, who labored much in the Lord.
hmr: Truphaina le Truphossa, Lalpaa sinthaw inrimhlakhai kha, chibai mi bûkpêk ro. Dittak Persi, Lalpaa sin thaw inrim bêk bêk ta kha chibai mi bûkpêk ro.

en: Salute Rufus the chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.
hmr: Lalpaa thlang, Rufa le a nu, ka nu ve bawk kha, chibai mi bûk pêk ro.

en: Salute Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermes, Patrobas, Hermas, and the brethren that are with them.
hmr: Asunkrita hai, Phlegon hai, Hermia hai, Patroba hai, Herma hai, an kuoma unau umhai leh chibai mi bûkpêk ro.

en: Salute Philologus and Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints that are with them.
hmr: Philologo le Julli, Nire le a farnu leh Olumpa leh an kuoma mi inthieng umhai po po le khan chibai mi bûkpêk ro.

en: Salute one another with a holy kiss. All the churches of Christ salute you.
hmr: Infâwp inthiengin chibai inbûk ro. Krista kohranhai po poin chibai an bûk tâwl cheu.

en: Now I beseech you, brethren, mark them that are causing the divisions and occasions of stumbling, contrary to the doctrine which ye learned: and turn away from them.
hmr: Chun, unauhai, inchûktirna thu, nangni inchûk nawna tieng pang in- ṭhena le tlukna siemtuhai chu vêng ṭha dingin le nghatsan dingin ka ngên cheu.

en: For they that are such serve not our Lord Christ, but their own belly; and by their smooth and fair speech they beguile the hearts of the innocent.
hmr: Chuong ang mihai chun, ei Lalpa Krista rawng chu an bâwl nawh a, anni phîng rawng an bâwl lem hlak a nih. An bau ṭhat le an bau thiemin mi mâwlhai lungril an hlêm hlak a nih.

en: For your obedience is come abroad unto all men. I rejoice therefore over you: but I would have you wise unto that which is good, and simple unto that which is evil.
hmr: In awizie chu mi po po kuomah ân thang suok ta sih a. Chuleiin, nangni chungthuah ka lâwm a nih; nisienlakhawm, a ṭha tieng in vara, a suol tieng in var naw ka nuom a nih.

en: And the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
hmr: Chun, Remna Pathien chun, in kepha hnuoiah um dingin Setan chu hung suknawi vak a tih. Lalpa Isu Krista lunginsietna chu in kuomah um raw se.

en: Timothy my fellow-worker saluteth you; and Lucius and Jason and Sosipater, my kinsmen.
hmr: Ka sinthawpui Timothe le ka chipui Lukia hai, Jason hai, Sosi- pater hai rawiin chibai an bûk cheu.

en: I Tertius, who write the epistle, salute you in the Lord.
hmr: Kei Terti, hi lekhathawn ziektu hin Lalpa hmingin chibai ka bûk cheu.

en: Gaius my host, and of the whole church, saluteth you. Erastus the treasurer of the city saluteth you, and Quartus the brother.
hmr: Kei le kohranhai po po tlungin- pa, Gaia chun chibai a bûk cheu. Khuoa sum enkawltu Erasta le, a unaupa Kuorta chun chibai an bûk cheu.
Ei Lalpa Isu Krista lungin- sietna chu in kuomah um raw se. Amen.

en: Now to him that is able to establish you according to my gospel and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery which hath been kept in silence through times eternal,
hmr: Tuhin ama chun, ka Chanchin Ṭha hril le, Krista thuhril le, kumkhuoa thurûk inthup suklanga um anga chun nangni a sukhrât thei cheu a.

en: but now is manifested, and by the scriptures of the prophets, according to the commandment of the eternal God, is made known unto all the nations unto obedience of faith:
hmr: Chu thurûk chu kumkhuo Pathien thupêk angin zâwlneihai le- khathuin hnam tin kuomah inhriettir a ni tah a, mi tinin an ringa an zâwm theina dingin.

en: to the only wise God, through Jesus Christ, to whom be the glory for ever. Amen.
hmr: Ama Pathien var tak chau kuom ngeia chun Isu Krista leiin kumkhuoin ropuina um raw se, Amen.

en: Wherefore thou art without excuse, O man, whosoever thou art that judgest: for wherein thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest dost practise the same things.
hmr: Chuleiin, aw mihriem, mi sawi- sêltu tûkhawm ni la, suonlam hrim i nei nawh, mi dang i sâwisêlna ngeia chun nang le nang thiemnaw inchangtir i nih i sawnnaw! nang a sawisêltu ngei khawma, chuong ang thil chu i thaw ve hlak sih a.

en: And we know that the judgment of God is according to truth against them that practise such things.
hmr: Chuong thil thaw hlaktuhai chunga Pathienin a sawisêlna chu thu indiktak a nih ti ei hriet sih a.

en: And reckonest thou this, O man, who judgest them that practise such things, and doest the same, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?
hmr: Aw mihriem, chuong ang thil thaw hlaktuhai sawisêltu, nangin chuong ang chu i thaw ve bawk sih a, Pathienin a sawisêlna chu pumpel în ring am a ni?

en: Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering, not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance?
hmr: Annawleh, Pathien ṭhatnain simna dingin a ṭhuoi hlak che ti hre loin, a ṭhatna hauzie le, a en theizie le, a zaidaw theizie dâm chu i ngainêp am a nih?

en: but after thy hardness and impenitent heart treasurest up for thyself wrath in the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God;
hmr: I lulul le i lungril ngar leiin, lungsenna le Pathien rorêlna feltak hung inlang ding nia ding chun i chungah lungsenna în khâwlkhâwm a ni lem a nih.

en: who will render to every man according to his works:
hmr: Pathien chun mi tin an sinthaw ang peiin rêlpêk a tih,

en: to them that by patience in well-doing seek for glory and honor and incorruption, eternal life:
hmr: thil ṭha thaw fan fana, ropuina le chawimawina le bohmang thei nawna zawngtuhai kuoma chun kumkhuoa hringna pêng a tih.

en: but unto them that are factious, and obey not the truth, but obey unrighteousness, shall be wrath and indignation,
hmr: Amiruokchu, kâwmaw suoh a, thutak zâwm loa fel nawna zâwm lemtuhai chunga chun Pathien lung senna le lungawinawna um a tih.

en: tribulation and anguish, upon every soul of man that worketh evil, of the Jew first, and also of the Greek;
hmr: Rinumna le lungngaina nasatak, mihriem thil suksuol pohai thlarau chungah um a ta, Juda mi thlarau chungah um hmasâng a ta, chun, Grik mi thlarau chungah um nâwk a tih.

en: but glory and honor and peace to every man that worketh good, to the Jew first, and also to the Greek:
hmr: Amiruokchu, thil ṭhataka thaw- tuhai po po kuoma chun ropuina dâm, chawimawina dâm, lung- muongna dâm pêk nîng a tih; Juda mihai kuomah pêk hmasak nîng a ta, chun, Grik mihai kuomah ni nâwk a tih.

en: for there is no respect of persons with God.
hmr: Pathienin mi ditsak bîk a nei si nawh a.

en: For as many as have sinned without the law shall also perish without the law: and as many as have sinned under the law shall be judged by the law;
hmr: Tûkhawm Dân nei loa thil suksuol chu Dân boin bohmang a ta; chun, tûkhawm Dân nei zinga suksuol chu, Dâna rêlpêkin um a tih.

en: for not the hearers of the law are just before God, but the doers of the law shall be justified;
hmr: Dân hretu ringawthai chu Pathien mithmuin mi fel an ni nawh a, Dân anga thawtuhai chu mi fela tiemin um lem an tih.

en: (for when Gentiles that have not the law do by nature the things of the law, these, not having the law, are the law unto themselves;
hmr: Dân nei naw Jentailhai hmanin an lungril insiengpuia dân thilhai kha an thawin, Dân nei naw hai sien khawm anni le anni chu dânah an insiem fâwm a,

en: in that they show the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience bearing witness therewith, and their thoughts one with another accusing or else excusing them);
hmr: an lungrilah dân sinthaw chu ziek a nih ti an inentir a; chu chu an sie le ṭha hrietnain an hrietpui a, an lungrilhai chu ân sêl a, akâr leh thiem ân changtir vak a, akâr leh thiemnaw ân changtir vak a.

en: in the day when God shall judge the secrets of men, according to my gospel, by Jesus Christ.
hmr: Pathienin ka Chanchin Ṭha hril anga mihriemhai thurûk Isu Krista hmanga a ngaituo ni chun chuong ang chu nîng a tih.

en: But if thou bearest the name of a Jew, and restest upon the law, and gloriest in God,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, nang Juda hming put i ni sih a, Dân chu i ringsan a, Pathien i suong a,

en: and knowest his will, and approvest the things that are excellent, being instructed out of the law,
hmr: a dit zâwng i hriet a, Dân thu inchûktirin i um leiin thil ṭhatak chu ṭha i tih a,

en: and art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind, a light of them that are in darkness,
hmr: nang ngei chu mitdelhai ṭhuoitu, inthima umhai êntu;

en: a corrector of the foolish, a teacher of babes, having in the law the form of knowledge and of the truth;
hmr: invêthai sukvartu le nautêhai inchûktirtu niin în ring a, Dâna chun varna le thutak um dân i nei leiin.

en: thou therefore that teachest another, teachest thou not thyself? thou that preachest a man should not steal, dost thou steal?
hmr: Chuong ang i ni si chun, nang mi danghai inchûktirtu, nang le nang în chûktir naw am a nih?

en: thou that sayest a man should not commit adultery, dost thou commit adultery? thou that abhorrest idols, dost thou rob temples?
hmr: Nang inru lo dinga mi dang hriltu, nangin în rûk hlak maw? Nang uire lo dinga mi dang hriltu, nang i uire maw? Nang milim theidatu, nangin milim biekna ina thilhai chu în rûk hlak maw?

en: thou who gloriest in the law, through thy transgression of the law dishonorest thou God?
hmr: Nang Dân suongtu, nangin Dân i bawsiet leiin Pathien chu i suk- hmingse hlak a ni maw?

en: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you, even as it is written.
hmr: An ziek ang ngei khan, Pathien hming chu nangni leiin Jentailhai laiah sukpâwiin a um ta a ni hi.

en: For circumcision indeed profiteth, if thou be a doer of the law: but if thou be a transgressor of the law, thy circumcision is become uncircumcision.
hmr: Dân zâwmtu i ni chun sertan chu a sâwt tak zet a nih; Dân bawsetu i ni ruok chun i sertan chu tan naw ang el a lo ni tah.

en: If therefore the uncircumcision keep the ordinances of the law, shall not his uncircumcision be reckoned for circumcision?
hmr: Chuleiin, sertan naw mîn Dân thu ruothai chu a vawng chun, a sertan naw chu tan anga ngai a ni naw ding am a nih?

en: and shall not the uncircumcision which is by nature, if it fulfil the law, judge thee, who with the letter and circumcision art a transgressor of the law?
hmr: Chun, mani insieng ziea sertan loin Dân chu a zâwm kim chun, nang, lekha thu le sertan dân nei sia Dân bawsetu chu a sawisêl naw ding che maw?

en: For he is not a Jew who is one outwardly; neither is that circumcision which is outward in the flesh:
hmr: Ân lang ela Juda mi ni chu Juda mi tak a ni nawh a; ân langa taksa mei meia sertan chu sertan tak tak a ni chuong naw bawk.

en: but he is a Jew who is one inwardly; and circumcision is that of the heart, in the spirit not in the letter; whose praise is not of men, but of God.
hmr: Amiruokchu, ân lang el ni loa Juda mi ni chu Juda tak a nih; chun, sertan tak chu lungril tienga tan a nih, Lekha thu ela ni loin, Thlarauah a nih; ama chun mihriem inpâk a hlaw nawh a, Pathien inpâk a hlaw lem hlak.

en: What advantage then hath the Jew? or what is the profit of circumcision?
hmr: Anleh Juda mi chun sâwtna ieng am a nei chuong bîk a? Sertan khawm chu a sâwtna ieng am a ni leh?

en: Much every way: first of all, that they were intrusted with the oracles of God.
hmr: Kawng tinrêngah a sâwt hle. Pathien thuhai an kuomah inkawl- tira a um lei a ni tak.

en: For what if some were without faith? shall their want of faith make of none effect the faithfulness of God?
hmr: Anni laia ṭhenkhathai ringum nawhai sien khawm ieng am a ni chuong leh? An ringumnawna chun Pathien ringumzie chu ieng khawm niloin a siem chuong am a nih?

en: God forbid: yea, let God be found true, but every man a liar; as it is written, That thou mightest be justified in thy words, And mightest prevail when thou comest into judgment.
hmr: Teu lo e! Pathien chu mi indiktak lo ni raw se, mi tin chu mi khêlhlip lo nihai sien khawm: “Nangin i thu hrilin thiem în changtir thei a, rorêlpêka i um khawma i hne theina dingin,” ti ziek ang khan.

en: But if our unrighteousness commendeth the righteousness of God, what shall we say? Is God unrighteous who visiteth with wrath? (I speak after the manner of men.)
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ei fel nawnahai hin Pathien felna chu a suklang mawi zuol si chun ieng am hril ei ta? Pathienin mi a hrem hin, mi fel lo a ni am a nih? (Mihriem dân takin hril ta inla).

en: God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?
hmr: Teu lo e! Chuong a ni chun Pathienin iengtin am khawvêl ro rêl a ta?

en: But if the truth of God through my lie abounded unto his glory, why am I also still judged as a sinner?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ka khêl hril leia Pathien thu indikzie ama sukropui khawp raua ân lang nâwk pei chun, ieng dinga kei khawm mi suol anga thiemnaw inchangtira la um rawp am ka na?

en: and why not (as we are slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say), Let us do evil, that good may come? whose condemnation is just.
hmr: Mîn an mi hêk a, mi ṭhenkhatin ka hril naw tawp an mîn hriltir angin ieng dinga, “Thil ṭha a hung theina dingin thil suol thâwng ei tiu,” tiin ei hril lem naw? Chuong ang mihai chun thiemnaw an chang chu a fel a nih.

en: What then? are we better than they? No, in no wise: for we before laid to the charge both of Jews and Greeks, that they are all under sin;
hmr: Annawleh, eini Judahai hi anni nêkin ei ṭha chuong bîk am a nih? Teu lo e! Judahai le Grikhai chu angkhat rawnga suolna suoka um vawng ei nih ti hi hma khawmin ei hril ta kha;

en: as it is written, There is none righteous, no, not one;
hmr: “Tukhawm mi fel hrim an um nawh. Pakhat bêk khawm an um nawh,

en: There is none that understandeth, There is none that seeketh after God;
hmr: Tûkhawm a hre thiem hrim an um nawh, Tûkhawm Pathien zawng hrim an um nawh.

en: They have all turned aside, they are together become unprofitable; There is none that doeth good, no, not so much as one:
hmr: A ni naw tieng an pêt vawng tah a, Ienga khawm hmang tlâk loin an um vawng tah a; Tûkhawm thil ṭha thaw hrim an um nawh; Pakhat bêk khawm an um nawh.

en: Their throat is an open sepulchre; With their tongues they have used deceit: The poison of asps is under their lips:
hmr: An hnuk chu thlân inhawng a na, An leiin inhlêmna thu a hril a, An bau sûngah rûl tûr a um a,

en: Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness:
hmr: An bau chu ṭawngseinphurna le thu khain a sip a.

en: Their feet are swift to shed blood;
hmr: An ke chu thisen insuo dingin a pên hrât a;

en: Destruction and misery are in their ways;
hmr: An lampuia chun bohmangna le rinumna a um a.

en: And the way of peace have they not known:
hmr: Lungmuongna lampui khawm an hriet nawh.

en: There is no fear of God before their eyes.
hmr: An mithmuah Pathien ṭina hrim a um nawh,” ti ziek ang khan.

en: Now we know that what things soever the law saith, it speaketh to them that are under the law; that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may be brought under the judgment of God:
hmr: Dânin iengkhawm a hril taphawt chu Dân thu thua umhai kuomah a hril a nih ti ei hriet a, bau tinrêng hupa a um theina ding le, khawvêla mi po po Pathien rorêla an um theina dingin.

en: because by the works of the law shall no flesh be justified in his sight; for through the law cometh the knowledge of sin.
hmr: Chuongchun, mi tukhawm Dâna thilthaw leiin a mithmuah thiem changin um naw ni hai; Dân leiin suol hriet famkimna a hung um a ni sih a.

en: But now apart from the law a righteousness of God hath been manifested, being witnessed by the law and the prophets;
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, tuhin Dân ṭhang loa Pathien felna chu suk- langin a um tah; Dân le zâwlneihai thu khawma a hril kha a nih;

en: even the righteousness of God through faith in Jesus Christ unto all them that believe; for there is no distinction;
hmr: chu chu Pathien felna, Isu Krista ringna leia ama awitu taphawt kuoma suklanga um chu a nih; a danglamna hrim a um nawh a.

en: for all have sinned, and fall short of the glory of God;
hmr: Mi po poin thil an suksuol vawng tah a, Pathien ropuina an chang zo ta naw a nih.

en: being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:
hmr: Chuong a ringtuhai chu Krista Isua intlanna um lei chun, lungin- sietnaa a thlâwna thiem inchangtirin an um a.

en: whom God set forth to be a propitiation, through faith, in his blood, to show his righteousness because of the passing over of the sins done aforetime, in the forbearance of God;
hmr: Pathienin ama felzie inentir dingin Krista Isu chu a thisen ringnaa suol thuphachawina dingin a ruot a. Pathien zaidawtheinain in- hmaa suolnahai chu hriet naw tehlêm a thaw a nih.

en: for the showing, I say, of his righteousness at this present season: that he might himself be just, and the justifier of him that hath faith in Jesus.
hmr: Ama ngei chu mi fel a nizie le Isua ringna nei taphawt thiem inchangtirtu a ni zie tulaia inentirna dingin a nih.

en: Where then is the glorying? It is excluded. By what manner of law? of works? Nay: but by a law of faith.
hmr: Insuongna chu khâwlai am a um leh? A puo tienga khâr nelin a um tah. Ieng dânin am a na? Thilthaw dânin am a nih? Ni lo e, Ringna dânin a ni lem.

en: We reckon therefore that a man is justified by faith apart from the works of the law.
hmr: Chuongchun, Dân thil thaw lei ni loin, ringna leiin miin thiem chang dingin ei ngai a nih.

en: Or is God the God of Jews only? is he not the God of Gentiles also? Yea, of Gentiles also:
hmr: Pathien chu Judahai Pathien chau am a nih? Jentailhai Pathien khaw m a ni ve naw am a nih? Ni veh e.

en: if so be that God is one, and he shall justify the circumcision by faith, and the uncircumcision through faith.
hmr: Sertanhai chu an ring leia thiem inchangtirtu ding le, sertan- nawhai chu an ring leia thiem inchangtirtu Pathien pakhat chau a ni si chun, Jentailhai Pathien khawm ni ve ngei naw ni.

en: Do we then make the law of none effect through faith? God forbid: nay, we establish the law.
hmr: Anleh, ringna lei ngawtin Dân chu iengkhawm ni loin ei siem el am a nih? Teu lo e! Dân chu ei sukdet lem hman a nih.

en: What then shall we say that Abraham, our forefather, hath found according to the flesh?
hmr: Anleh, Abraham, tisa dâna ei thlatu chun a hmu ieng am hril ei ta?

en: For if Abraham was justified by works, he hath whereof to glory; but not toward God.
hmr: Abrahamin a thilthaw leiin thiem a chang si chun, suong ding a nei a nih; Pathien tieng ruok chun a nei nawh a;

en: For what saith the scripture? And Abraham believed God, and it was reckoned unto him for righteousness.
hmr: Pathien Lekhain ieng am a hril a? “Abraham chun Pathien a ring a, chu ringna chu a felnaa ngai a nih,” tiin a hril a nih.

en: Now to him that worketh, the reward is not reckoned as of grace, but as of debt.
hmr: Chun, sinthawtu hlaw chu lunginsietnaa ngai a ni nawh a, bat anga ngai a ni lem a nih.

en: But to him that worketh not, but believeth on him that justifieth the ungodly, his faith is reckoned for righteousness.
hmr: Amiruokchu, mi, a thilthawa innghat loa, Pathien hre nawhai thiem inchangtirtu ring lemtu ringna chu, a felnaa ngai a nih.

en: Even as David also pronounceth blessing upon the man, unto whom God reckoneth righteousness apart from works,
hmr: Mi, a thilthaw ngaituo loa, Pathienin fela a ingaihai hamṭhatzie chu David khawmin:-

en: saying, Blessed are they whose iniquities are forgiven, And whose sins are covered.
hmr: “An bawsietnahai ngaidama umhai le, An suolhai inkhuma um chu An hamṭha.

en: Blessed is the man to whom the Lord will not reckon sin.
hmr: Lalpain suol neia a ingai naw chu an hamṭha,” tia a hril ang khan.

en: Is this blessing then pronounced upon the circumcision, or upon the uncircumcision also? for we say, To Abraham his faith was reckoned for righteousness.
hmr: Anleh, chu hamṭhatna chu sertanhai chung chau âm a ni a um, sertan nawhai chunga khawm? “Abraham ringna chu a felnaa ruot a nih” ei ti sih a.

en: How then was it reckoned? when he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision:
hmr: Chu chu iengti ziea ngai am ni tâng a ta? A sertan hmain am a ni, a sertan hnungin? A sertan hnungin a ni nawh a, a sertan hmain a ni lem a nih.

en: and he received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had while he was in uncircumcision: that he might be the father of all them that believe, though they be in uncircumcision, that righteousness might be reckoned unto them;
hmr: Chuongchun, sertan loa a um laia, ringnain felna chu a hmu ti inhrietna, sertan inchikna chu a hmuh a, chu felna chu an ta dinga ruot a nina dingin sertan lohai laia ringtuhai po po pa a ni theina dingin,

en: and the father of circumcision to them who not only are of the circumcision, but who also walk in the steps of that faith of our father Abraham which he had in uncircumcision.
hmr: sertanhai pa khawm a ni thei bawkna dingin– sertanhai pa chau a ni nawh a, ama, ei pa Abraham sertan loa a um laia, ringna a nei anga nei fâwmhai pa a ni lem a nih.

en: For not through the law was the promise to Abraham or to his seed that he should be heir of the world, but through the righteousness of faith.
hmr: Dân leiin Abraham le a thlahai kuoma chun khawvêl ro hluo ding thu chu tiem a ni nawh a, ringnaa felna lei a ni lem.

en: For if they that are of the law are heirs, faith is made void, and the promise is made of none effect:
hmr: Dâna mihai rohluotuhai an ni si chun, ringna ienga khawm hmang a ni ta nawh a, thutiem khawm chu iengkhawm a ni ta nawh;

en: for the law worketh wrath; but where there is no law, neither is there transgression.
hmr: Dân chun lunginsenna a siem hlak sih a; Dân um nawnaa chun bawsietna khawm a um bawk nawh.

en: For this cause it is of faith, that it may be according to grace; to the end that the promise may be sure to all the seed; not to that only which is of the law, but to that also which is of the faith of Abraham, who is the father of us all
hmr: Chuleiin, lunginsietna a ni theina dingin, ringna leiin a nih hi suon po pohai chun thutiem chu matheiloa an hmu chu. Dân nei mi chauin an hmu ding a ni nawh a, Abraham ringna ang ringna neihai khawmin hmûng an tih. Abraham chu ei rênga pa a nih,

en: (as it is written, A father of many nations have I made thee) before him whom he believed, even God, who giveth life to the dead, and calleth the things that are not, as though they were.
hmr: mithihai sukhringtu le, thil umnawhai a taka inumtirtu, a iring Pathien mithmua chun; “Chi tam- takhai pain siem ka ti che” tia ziek ang khan.

en: Who in hope believed against hope, to the end that he might become a father of many nations, according to that which had been spoken, So shall thy seed be.
hmr: Beiseina âwm a um naw khawmin beiseitakin a ring a, chi tamtakhai pa a hung ni theina dingin, “Khi zât khin i thlahai la um an tih,” tia hril ang khan.

en: And without being weakened in faith he considered his own body now as good as dead (he being about a hundred years old), and the deadness of Sarah’s womb;
hmr: Chun, ringna detlo chuong loin, a taksa thi tah anga um chu a ngaituoh a, ama chu kum za lai mi a ni sih a, Sara ching khawm a ngaituo bawk a.

en: yet, looking unto the promise of God, he wavered not through unbelief, but waxed strong through faith, giving glory to God,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ringna tlasam- in Pathien thutiem chu a ringhla chuong nawh a, Pathien a châwimawi a;

en: and being fully assured that what he had promised, he was able also to perform.
hmr: a thutiem chu ân hlawtling tir thei ti a ring hle bawk a, a ringna chu a hung det lem tah a.

en: Wherefore also it was reckoned unto him for righteousness.
hmr: Chuleiin a ringna chu a felnaa ngai a hung ni tah.

en: Now it was not written for his sake alone, that it was reckoned unto him;
hmr: Chuongchun, a ringna chu a felnaa ngai a ni ti ama ta ding chaua ziek a ni nawh a,

en: but for our sake also, unto whom it shall be reckoned, who believe on him that raised Jesus our Lord from the dead,
hmr: Isu, ei Lalpa mithi laia inthawka keithotu ringtu einihai ta ding khawmin a nih, ei ringna chu felnaa ngai nîng a tih.

en: who was delivered up for our trespasses, and was raised for our justification.
hmr: Chu Isu chu ei suolna leiin inmantirin a um a, thiem ei changna dingin keithoin a um bawk a.

en: Being therefore justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ;
hmr: Chuleiin, ringna leia thiem changa umin, ei Lalpa Isu Krista leiin Pathien le inremin ei um a;

en: through whom also we have had our access by faith into this grace wherein we stand; and we rejoice in hope of the glory of God.
hmr: ama lei bawk chun hi lungin- sietnaa ei ngir detnaa hin ringnain ei lût tah a, Pathien ropuina beiseiin lâwmin ei um bawk a nih.

en: And not only so, but we also rejoice in our tribulations: knowing that tribulation worketh stedfastness;
hmr: Chu chau chu ni loin, ei rimsiknaa khawm lâwmin ei um a nih, rimsikna chun selna a siem a,

en: and stedfastness, approvedness; and approvedness, hope:
hmr: tuorselna chun hriet fiena a siem a, hriet fiena chun beiseina a siem ti ei hriet sih a.

en: and hope putteth not to shame; because the love of God hath been shed abroad in our hearts through the Holy Spirit which was given unto us.
hmr: Chun, Thlarau Inthieng ei kuoma a mi pêk khan Pathien hma- ngaina chu ei lungrilah a hung buok ta leiin beiseina chun a mi sukbeidawng nawh a.

en: For while we were yet weak, in due season Christ died for the ungodly.
hmr: Ei la hrât naw lai khan a hun takah Krista chu mi suolhai ai chun a lo thi ta sih a.

en: For scarcely for a righteous man will one die: for peradventure for the good man some one would even dare to die.
hmr: Mi fel aia thi miin a nuom naw âwm hle sih a, mi ṭha ai ruok chun mi tûamani bêk chun thi a lo ngam khiet rawi mawh.

en: But God commendeth his own love toward us, in that, while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pathien chun a mi hmangaina chu inpâk tlâkin ân langtir a, mi suolhai ei la ni laia Krista eini aia a thinaa khan.

en: Much more then, being now justified by his blood, shall we be saved from the wrath of God through him.
hmr: Chuongchun, a thisena thiem inchangtira ei um ta hin chu, ama lei bawkin Pathien lungsennaa in- thawkin sandamin um ngei ei tih.

en: For if, while we were enemies, we were reconciled to God through the death of his Son, much more, being reconciled, shall we be saved by his life;
hmr: Hmêlma ei ni lai hmana, a Naupa thina leia Pathien le lo inrem tah ei ni chun, inrema ei um ta hnung lem hin chu a hringna leiin sandamin um ngei ei tih.

en: and not only so, but we also rejoice in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom we have now received the reconciliation.
hmr: Chuong chau khawm chu a ni nawh a, inremna tuta a mîn hmutirtu ei Lalpa Isu Krista lei chun Pathienah ei lâwm bawk a nih.

en: Therefore, as through one man sin entered into the world, and death through sin; and so death passed unto all men, for that all sinned:—
hmr: Chuongchun, mi pakhat leiin suol khawvêla hin a lût a, suol leiin thina a lût bawk a; chuong ang bawkin mi po poin thil an lo suksuol ta leiin thinain mi po po a fang suok tah a.

en: for until the law sin was in the world; but sin is not imputed when there is no law.
hmr: Dân um hmain suol khawvêlah a um ta sih a; dân a um si naw chun suol chu suola ngai a ni nawh.

en: Nevertheless death reigned from Adam until Moses, even over them that had not sinned after the likeness of Adam’s transgression, who is a figure of him that was to come.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Adama in- thawk Mosie um chenin Adam bawsietna anga thil suksuol nawhai chunga khawm thina chun ro a rêl hlak a. Adam chu la hung dingpa hlimthla chu a nih.

en: But not as the trespass, so also is the free gift. For if by the trespass of the one the many died, much more did the grace of God, and the gift by the grace of the one man, Jesus Christ, abound unto the many.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, thilthlâwnpêk chu bawsietna leh ân ang nawh. Mi pakhat bawsietna lei hman khan mi tamtak chu an thi si chun, Pathien lunginsietna le mi pakhat Isu Krista lunginsietna leia thilpêk chu, mi tamtak chungah vurin um ngei a tih.

en: And not as through one that sinned, so is the gift: for the judgment came of one unto condemnation, but the free gift came of many trespasses unto justification.
hmr: Chun, chu thilpêk chu mi pakhat suol leia thil hung um le chun ân ang bawk nawh; thiemnaw inchangtirna rorêlna chu mi pakhat leiin a hung um a, thiem inchang- tirna thilthlâwnpêk ruok chu bawsietna tamtak leiin a hung um ta lem a nih.

en: For if, by the trespass of the one, death reigned through the one; much more shall they that receive the abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness reign in life through the one, even Jesus Christ.
hmr: Mi pakhat bawsietna leiin, mi pakhat lei hmana thinain ro a rêl si chun, lunginsietna nasatak le felna thilpêk lo changtuhai khan mi pakhat Isu Krista lei khan hringnaa chun ro rêl ngei an tih.

en: So then as through one trespass the judgment came unto all men to condemnation; even so through one act of righteousness the free gift came unto all men to justification of life.
hmr: Chuongchun, mi pakhat baw- sietna leiin, thiemnaw inchangtirna rorêlna chu mi po po chungah a hung um a; chuong ang bawkin thil fel pakhat thaw lei chun, hringna hmu- na dinga thiem inchangtirna thil- thlâwnpêk chu mi po po chungah a hung um.

en: For as through the one man’s disobedience the many were made sinners, even so through the obedience of the one shall the many be made righteous.
hmr: Mi pakhat thu awi nawna lei khan mi tamtak chu mi suol an hung ni tah; chuong ang bawkin mi pakhat thuawi lei khan mi tamtak chu mi fel hung nîng an tih.

en: And the law came in besides, that the trespass might abound; but where sin abounded, grace did abound more exceedingly:
hmr: Chun, bawsietna chu ân lang nawk zuol theina dingin Dân a hung um nâwk nghâl a. Nisienlakhawm, suol a pungna poah lunginsietna chu a pung zuol pei hlak;

en: that, as sin reigned in death, even so might grace reign through righteousness unto eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.
hmr: suol chun thinain ro a rêl ang takin, lunginsietna chun, felnain kumkhaw hringna changna khawp hielin ei Lalpa Isu Krista zârah ro a rêl theina dingin.

en: What shall we say then? Shall we continue in sin, that grace may abound?
hmr: Ieng am hril tâng ei ta? Lunginsietna chu a pung nâwk zuolna dingin suolin ei um zing ding am a nih?

en: God forbid. We who died to sin, how shall we any longer live therein?
hmr: Teu lo e a! Eini suol tienga thi ta hnunghai iengtin am suolin la hring zing thei ei ta?

en: Or are ye ignorant that all we who were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death?
hmr: Eini laia Krista Isua baptisma changhai po chu, a thinaah baptisin ei um ti in hriet naw maw?

en: We were buried therefore with him through baptism into death: that like as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, so we also might walk in newness of life.
