hmr: Chuleiin, a thinaa baptisma ei changin, a kuomah phûmin ei um veh a; Pa ropuinain mithi laia inthawka Krista a keitho ang khan, eini khawm hringna thara ei um theina dingin.

en: For if we have become united with him in the likeness of his death, we shall be also in the likeness of his resurrection;
hmr: A thina inangpuia ama leh ei inzawm ta si chun, a thonâwkna in- angpuia khawm inzawm bawk ei tih.

en: knowing this, that our old man was crucified with him, that the body of sin might be done away, that so we should no longer be in bondage to sin;
hmr: Hieng hi ei hriet; ei mihriem hlui chu a kuoma hemdein a um ve tah, suol taksa chu sukboa a um theina dinga, tuta chen chu suol suoka ei um ta nawna dingin.

en: for he that hath died is justified from sin.
hmr: Tûkhawm a thi ta chu suola inthawkin a suok ta sih a.

en: But if we died with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with him;
hmr: Chun, Krista kuomah ei thi ve ta chun, a kuomah hring ve bawk ei tih, ti ei ring a nih;

en: knowing that Christ being raised from the dead dieth no more; death no more hath dominion over him.
hmr: Krista chu mithi laia inthawka keithoin a um a, a thi nâwk ta naw ding a nih, ti ei hriet sih a.

en: For the death that he died, he died unto sin once: but the life that he liveth, he liveth unto God.
hmr: Thina chun ama chungah thu a nei ta nawh. A thina chu suol tieng kawnga kumkhuoa dingin vawikhat chau a thi a na, a hringna ruok chu Pathien tieng kawnga hring a nih.

en: Even so reckon ye also yourselves to be dead unto sin, but alive unto God in Christ Jesus.
hmr: Chuong ang bawkin, nangni khawm suol tieng kawngah thi taah inngai unla, Pathien tieng kawnga ruok chun Krista Isua chun hringah inngai ro.

en: Let not sin therefore reign in your mortal body, that ye should obey the lusts thereof:
hmr: Chuleiin, in taksa nuom zâwng ang in zâwmna dingin, in taksa thi theia chun suolnain ro rêl naw raw se.

en: neither present your members unto sin as instruments of unrighteousness; but present yourselves unto God, as alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of righteousness unto God.
hmr: In taksa pênghai khawm fel nawna hriemhrei dingin suolna kuomah pe phal bawk naw ro; nisienlakhawm, mithi laia inthawka hring nâwk angin Pathien kuomah inpe unla, in taksa pênghai khawm chu felna hriemhrei dingin Pathien kuomah pe phal lem ro.

en: For sin shall not have dominion over you: for ye are not under law, but under grace.
hmr: Suolnain in chungah thu a nei ta naw ding a ni sih a, Dân rorêla um in ni nawh a, lunginsietna rorêla um in ni lem sih a.

en: What then? shall we sin, because we are not under law, but under grace? God forbid.
hmr: Iengtin am nîng a ta? Dân rorêla um ei ni nawh a, lunginsietna rorêla um ei ni lem lei hin ei suol ding am a nih? Teu lo e a!

en: Know ye not, that to whom ye present yourselves as servants unto obedience, his servants ye are whom ye obey; whether of sin unto death, or of obedience unto righteousness?
hmr: Tu kuoma khawm an thu awi dinga an suoka in lût chun, thina khawpa suol suok amanih, felna khawpa thuawina suok amani khawm ni sienla, a thu in iawi suok chu in nih ti in hriet naw am a nih?

en: But thanks be to God, that, whereas ye were servants of sin, ye became obedient from the heart to that form of teaching whereunto ye were delivered;
hmr: Amiruokchu, Pathien kuomah lâwmthu um raw se! suol suok ni unla khawm inchûktir dân,a kuoma in inpêkna chu lungril tak zetin in lo awi a;

en: and being made free from sin, ye became servants of righteousness.
hmr: chun, suola inthawk chu insuoin in um a, felna suokhai in hung ni ta sih a.

en: I speak after the manner of men because of the infirmity of your flesh: for as ye presented your members as servants to uncleanness and to iniquity unto iniquity, even so now present your members as servants to righteousness unto sanctification.
hmr: (In taksa hrât nawna leiin mihriem dânin thu ka hril a nih). In taksa pênghai chu inthieng nawna kuoma le bawsietna dinga bawsietna kuomah suoka in pêk phal ang khan, tuhin in taksa pênghai chu inthiengna dingin felna kuomah suok dingin pe phal ro.

en: For when ye were servants of sin, ye were free in regard of righteousness.
hmr: Suolna suokhai in ni lai khan felna tieng chu in fihlim a nih.

en: What fruit then had ye at that time in the things whereof ye are now ashamed? for the end of those things is death.
hmr: Tuta in thil inzâpui tahaia hin khâng lai khan ra ieng am in lo hmu hlak leh? Khang thil tâwpna kha thina a nih in sawnnaw.

en: But now being made free from sin and become servants to God, ye have your fruit unto sanctification, and the end eternal life.
hmr: Tu ruok hin chu suola inthawka sukfihlîma um a, Pathien suokhai in hung ni hin, inthiengna hmu khawpin ra in nei in sawnnaw; chu chu tâwpna kumkhuoa hringna leh.

en: For the wages of sin is death; but the free gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.
hmr: Suol man chu thina a ni sih a; Pathien thilthlâwnpêk ruok chu ei Lalpa Krista Isu zârah chatuona hringna a nih.

en: Or are ye ignorant, brethren (for I speak to men who know the law), that the law hath dominion over a man for so long time as he liveth?
hmr: Anleh, unauhai, dân chun mi a dam sûng po a chungah ro a rêl hlak ti in hriet naw am an nih? (Dân hre mihai kuomah ka hril a ni hi).

en: For the woman that hath a husband is bound by law to the husband while he liveth; but if the husband die, she is discharged from the law of the husband.
hmr: Nuhmei pasal nei chu a pasal dam sûng po dânin a pasala khuopdein a um hlak; nisien- lakhawm, a pasal a thi chun, pasal kawngah dâna inthawka insuoin a um hlak.

en: So then if, while the husband liveth, she be joined to another man, she shall be called an adulteress: but if the husband die, she is free from the law, so that she is no adulteress, though she be joined to another man.
hmr: Chuongchun, a pasal dam sûnga mi dang a nei chun “uirenu” tîng an tih; a pasal a thi ruok chun, chu dâna inthawk chun inthlain a um a; chuongchun, mi dang nei sien khawm uire a ni ta nawh.

en: Wherefore, my brethren, ye also were made dead to the law through the body of Christ; that ye should be joined to another, even to him who was raised from the dead, that we might bring forth fruit unto God.
hmr: Chuongchun, unauhai, Krista taksa pêng in ni leiin dân kawnga sukhlumin in lo um tah a, mi dang, mithi laia inthawka a keitho kha, in nei thei tah, Pathien tienga kan ra theina dingin.

en: For when we were in the flesh, the sinful passions, which were through the law, wrought in our members to bring forth fruit unto death.
hmr: Tisaa ei um lai khan Dân leia nuom zâwng suol hung suokhai chun ei taksa pêngahai thina khawpa ra dingin sin a hung thaw hlak.

en: But now we have been discharged from the law, having died to that wherein we were held; so that we serve in newness of the spirit, and not in oldness of the letter.
hmr: Tu ruok hin chu a mi cheltu chu thisanin, Dâna inthawkin inthlain ei um tah; chuleichun lekha ziek hlui ang ni loin, Thlarau tharin rawng ei bâwl theina dingin.

en: What shall we say then? Is the law sin? God forbid. Howbeit, I had not known sin, except through the law: for I had not known coveting, except the law had said, Thou shalt not covet:
hmr: Ieng am hril tâng ei ta? Dân chu suol am a nih? Teu lo e a; Nisien- lakhawm, Dân leia hriet ni naw sien chu suol ka hriet naw ding bah; Dân chun, “Inhnar naw,” ti naw sien chu inhnar hi ka hriet naw ding bah.

en: but sin, finding occasion, wrought in me through the commandment all manner of coveting: for apart from the law sin is dead.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, suolin thupêk lei chun remchâng lai hmuin, inhnarna tinrêng ka sûngah ân umtir a. Dân naw chun suolna chu a thi a nih.

en: And I was alive apart from the law once: but when the commandment came, sin revived, and I died;
hmr: Chun, kha hma khan kei dân nei loin ka hring a; nisienlakhawm, thupêk chu a hung um phingleh suolna chu a hung har a, kei chu ka thi tah a.

en: and the commandment, which was unto life, this I found to be unto death:
hmr: Chun, hringna dinga thupêk chu thina ding lem a nih ti ka hung hriet tah a;

en: for sin, finding occasion, through the commandment beguiled me, and through it slew me.
hmr: suolna chun thupêk lei chun, remchângna hmuin a mi lo hlêm a, thupêk chu hmangin a mi sukhlum tah a nih.

en: So that the law is holy, and the commandment holy, and righteous, and good.
hmr: Chuongchun, Dân chu ân thieng a, thupêk khawm chu ân thieng a, a fel a, a ṭha a nih.

en: Did then that which is good become death unto me? God forbid. But sin, that it might be shown to be sin, by working death to me through that which is good;—that through the commandment sin might become exceeding sinful.
hmr: Anleh, thil ṭha chu keia ta dingin thina a lo ni am a nih? Teu lo e a! Suolna chu keia ta dingin thina a hung ni ta lem a nih; chuongchun, suolna chu suolna a nih ti ân lang theina dingin, thil ṭha chu hmangin a mi sukhlum a nih. Suolna chu thupêk lei khan suol nasatak a ni theina dingin.

en: For we know that the law is spiritual: but I am carnal, sold under sin.
hmr: Dân chu Thlarau tieng thil a nih ti ei hriet sih a; kei ruok chu tisa tienga mi, suol suoka zawr ta hnung ka nih.

en: For that which I do I know not: for not what I would, that do I practise; but what I hate, that I do.
hmr: Sin ka thawhai hi a ngaina ka hriet si nawh a, ka thaw hlakhai hi ka thaw nuom zâwng khawm a ni si nawh a; ka itheida zâwngtak chu ka thaw lem hlak a nih.

en: But if what I would not, that I do, I consent unto the law that it is good.
hmr: Ka thaw nuom naw zâwng chu ka thaw si chun, Dân chu a ṭha tia awi nîng ka tih.

en: So now it is no more I that do it, but sin which dwelleth in me.
hmr: Chuongchun, thil ka thawhai hi keiin ka thaw a ni ta nawh a, suolna keimaa um chun a thaw a ni lem a nih.

en: For I know that in me, that is, in my flesh, dwelleth no good thing: for to will is present with me, but to do that which is good is not.
hmr: Keimaa hin, chu chu ka tisaa hin tina a nih, thil ṭha hrim a um nawh ti ka hriet, thil ṭha thaw nuomna chu keimaah a umdea chu, thil ṭha thawna chu a um si nawh a.

en: For the good which I would I do not: but the evil which I would not, that I practise.
hmr: Ṭhatna thaw ka nuoma chu ka thaw naw a, suolna ka thaw nuom naw chu ka thaw sih a.

en: But if what I would not, that I do, it is no more I that do it, but sin which dwelleth in me.
hmr: Ka nuom naw zâwng ka thaw si chun, a thawtu chu kei ka ni ta nawh a, suol keimaa um chu a ni lem a nih.

en: I find then the law, that, to me who would do good, evil is present.
hmr: Chuongchun, hi dân hi ka hung hriet suok tah; thil ṭha thaw ka nuom laiin suolna ka kuomah a hung um hlak a nih.

en: For I delight in the law of God after the inward man:
hmr: Ka lungril takin Pathien dân chungah ka lâwm si hlak a;

en: but I see a different law in my members, warring against the law of my mind, and bringing me into captivity under the law of sin which is in my members.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, ka taksa pêng- haia hin dân danglam a um ti ka hriet, chu chun ka lungrila dân chu a do a, ka taksa pênghaia suolna dân umhai chun salah a mi ṭhuoi a nih.

en: Wretched man that I am! who shall deliver me out of the body of this death?
hmr: Mi rimsi ka va ni ngei de aw! Hi thina taksaa inthawk hin tuin am mi sansuok a ta?

en: I thank God through Jesus Christ our Lord. So then I of myself with the mind, indeed, serve the law of God; but with the flesh the law of sin.
hmr: Isu Krista ei Lalpa lei chun Pathien kuomah lâwmthu ka hril a nih. Chuongchun, keima tak chun, ka lungril chun, Pathien dân rawng ka bâwl hlak, ka tisa ruok chun suolna dân rawng ka bâwl hlak.

en: There is therefore now no condemnation to them that are in Christ Jesus.
hmr: Chuongchun, tuhin chu Krista Isua umhai ta ding chun thiem- naw inchangtirna hrim a um ta nawh.

en: For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus made me free from the law of sin and of death.
hmr: Krista Isua Hringna Thlarau dân chun suolna le thina dâna inthawk chun a mi sansuok ta sih a.

en: For what the law could not do, in that it was weak through the flesh, God, sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh and for sin, condemned sin in the flesh:
hmr: Tisa leiin Dân chu a hrât nawh a, a thaw thei ruol naw chu Pathienin ama Naupa ngei tisa suol ang putin suol thawina dinga hung tirin, tisaa suolna um chu thiemnaw ân changtir tah a nih,

en: that the ordinance of the law might be fulfilled in us, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.
hmr: tisa dân hraw lo a, Thlarau dân hraw lemtu einia hin Dân thu ruot chu hlena a um theina dingin.

en: For they that are after the flesh mind the things of the flesh; but they that are after the Spirit the things of the Spirit.
hmr: Tisa dâna umhai chun tisa tieng thilhai an dit hlak; Thlarau dâna umhai ruok chun thlarau tieng thilhai an dit hlak. Tisa tieng thil dit chu thina a ni sih a;

en: For the mind of the flesh is death; but the mind of the Spirit is life and peace:
hmr: Thlarau tieng thil dit ruok chu hringna le lungmuongna a nih;

en: because the mind of the flesh is enmity against God; for it is not subject to the law of God, neither indeed can it be:
hmr: tisa dit zâwng chu Pathien dona a ni sih a. Chu chu Pathien dânin a um nghâl si nawh a, um khawm a um thei bawk nawh.

en: and they that are in the flesh cannot please God.
hmr: Chuleiin, tisaa umhai chun Pathien an suklâwm thei nawh.

en: But ye are not in the flesh but in the Spirit, if so be that the Spirit of God dwelleth in you. But if any man hath not the Spirit of Christ, he is none of his.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pathien Thlarau chu nangniah a chêng takzet a ni chun, tisaa um ni loin, Thlaraua um in ni lem. Tukhawm Krista Thlarau nei naw chu ama mi a ni nawh.

en: And if Christ is in you, the body is dead because of sin; but the spirit is life because of righteousness.
hmr: Krista chu nangniah a um ruok chun, in taksa chu suolna leia thi khawm ni sien, Pathiena thiem changa um in ni leiin in thlarau chu a hring a nih.

en: But if the Spirit of him that raised up Jesus from the dead dwelleth in you, he that raised up Christ Jesus from the dead shall give life also to your mortal bodies through his Spirit that dwelleth in you.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mithi laia inthawka Isu keitho nâwktu Thlarau kha nangniah a um chun, mithi laia inthawka Krista Isu keitho nâwktu khan nangnia um Thlarau zâra chun, in taksa thi theihai chu sukhring bawk a tih.

en: So then, brethren, we are debtors, not to the flesh, to live after the flesh:
hmr: Chuleichun, unauhai, bat ei nei, tisa dâna um lo dingin, tisa kuoma khawm ni bawk loin.

en: for if ye live after the flesh, ye must die; but if by the Spirit ye put to death the deeds of the body, ye shall live.
hmr: Tisa dâna in um chun in thi ngei ding a nih; amiruokchu, taksa thil- thawhai chu Thlaraua in sukhlum hlak chun hring in tih.

en: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, these are sons of God.
hmr: Pathien Thlarau ṭhuoia umhai po chu Pathien nauhai an ni sih a.

en: For ye received not the spirit of bondage again unto fear; but ye received the spirit of adoption, whereby we cry, Abba, Father.
hmr: Ṭia um nâwk dingin suok nina thlarau in hmu a ni si nawh a; nau nina thlarau in hmu lem a nih; chu thlarau zâra chun, “Abba! (Pa)” tiin ei khêk hlak hi.

en: The Spirit himself beareth witness with our spirit, that we are children of God:
hmr: Thlarau ngei chun, eini thlarau leh, Pathien nauhai ei nih ti a mîn hriettir hlak.

en: and if children, then heirs; heirs of God, and joint-heirs with Christ; if so be that we suffer with him, that we may be also glorified with him.
hmr: Chun, nauhai ei ni chun ro- hluotuhai, Pathien rohluotu, Krista hluopuituhai ei nih; chuleiin, ama ei tuorpui ding a nih, a kuoma chawimawia ei um ve theina dingin.

en: For I reckon that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory which shall be revealed to us-ward.
hmr: Tulaia tuornahai hi ei chunga ropuina suklanga la um ding le chun hrilkhi khawpa ka ngai si nawh a.

en: For the earnest expectation of the creation waiteth for the revealing of the sons of God.
hmr: Thilsiemhai chun beiseitakin Pathien nauhai hung inlangna chu an nghâkhla hle sih a.

en: For the creation was subjected to vanity, not of its own will, but by reason of him who subjected it, in hope
hmr: Thilsiem po pohai chu, thil teplo thu thua inumtirin an um tah; an nuoma um an ni nawh a, ân umtirtu lei a ni lem a nih.

en: that the creation itself also shall be delivered from the bondage of corruption into the liberty of the glory of the children of God.
hmr: Beiseina neiin thilsiemhai po po khawm chu sietna suoka inthawka insuoin um an ta, Pathien nauhai zalênna ropuia chun an lût ding a ni sih a.

en: For we know that the whole creation groaneth and travaileth in pain together until now.
hmr: Thilsiem po pohai chu tu chen hin inrûm le nauhasena tuorin an um tâwl ti ei hriet sih a.

en: And not only so, but ourselves also, who have the first-fruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, waiting for our adoption, to wit, the redemption of our body.
hmr: Chu chau khawm chu ni loin, eini, Thlarau rahmasa neituhai ngei khawm hin, nau ei nina (ei taksa intlanna) chu nghâkin, eini meu khawm ei lungrilin ei inrûm sih a.

en: For in hope were we saved: but hope that is seen is not hope: for who hopeth for that which he seeth?
hmr: Beiseinain a nih, sandama ei um chu; nisienlakhawm, hmu thei zing beiseina hi beiseina a ni nawh a, miin a hmu thei zing chu iengtin am a la beisei hlak a?

en: But if we hope for that which we see not, then do we with patience wait for it.
hmr: Ei hmu naw chu ei beisei chun ei nghâk fan fan hlak a nih.

en: And in like manner the Spirit also helpeth our infirmity: for we know not how to pray as we ought; but the Spirit himself maketh intercession for us with groanings which cannot be uttered;
hmr: Chuong ang bawkin, Thlarau chun ei hrât nawnahaiah a mi ṭhang- pui hlak a; ieng anga ṭawngṭai ding am a ni ti ei hriet si nawh a; nisienlakhawm, Thlarau chun inrûm hril ruol loin a mi ṭawngṭai pêk hlak.

en: and he that searcheth the hearts knoweth what is the mind of the Spirit, because he maketh intercession for the saints according to the will of God.
hmr: Chun, Pathien dit zâwng ang peiin mi inthienghai chu a ṭawngṭai pêk hlak leiin, lungrilhai entu chun Thlarau dit zâwng chu a hriet hlak a nih.

en: And we know that to them that love God all things work together for good, even to them that are called according to his purpose.
hmr: Chun, Pathien hmangaituhai amain a ruot anga a kohai ta ding chun, an ṭhatna dingin iengkimin a thawpêk hlak ti ei hriet a.

en: For whom he foreknew, he also foreordained to be conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brethren:
hmr: A hrietlâwkhai chu ama Naupa ang taka um dingin a ruot lâwk sih a, a Naupa chu unau tamtak laia nau lutîr a hung ni theina dingin.

en: and whom he foreordained, them he also called: and whom he called, them he also justified: and whom he justified, them he also glorified.
hmr: Chun, a ruot lâwkhai chu a ko bawk a; a kohai chu thiem ân changtir bawk a; chun, thiem ân changtir hai chu a châwimâwi bawk a.

en: What then shall we say to these things? If God is for us, who is against us?
hmr: Chuong thua chun ieng am hril tâng ei ta? Pathien eini tieng a ṭhang chun tuin am mi do thei a ta?

en: He that spared not his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how shall he not also with him freely give us all things?
hmr: Ama naupa ngei khawm hla loa, ei rênga aia petu chun, thil dang po po khawm a thlâwnin a mi pêk sa naw ding am a nih?

en: Who shall lay anything to the charge of God’s elect? It is God that justifieth;
hmr: Pathien mi thlanghai chu tuin am hêk a ta? Thiem inchangtirtu kha Pathien a ni sih a.

en: who is he that condemneth? It is Christ Jesus that died, yea rather, that was raised from the dead, who is at the right hand of God, who also maketh intercession for us.
hmr: Tuin am thiemnaw inchangtir a ti leh? A thi chu Isu Krista chu a ni sih a, anih, mithi laia inthawka tho nâwk ta lem a, Pathien changtienga uma a mi hrilpêktu bawk kha a nih.

en: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? shall tribulation, or anguish, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?
hmr: Krista hmangainaa inthawk chu tuin am mi ṭhêng a ta? Rinum- nain amanih, lungngainain amanih, suknawmnatnain amanih, ṭâmin amanih, saruoknain amanih ṭiumin amanih, kâwlhnâmin amanih a mi ṭhe ding am a nih?

en: Even as it is written, For thy sake we are killed all the day long; We were accounted as sheep for the slaughter.
hmr: “Nangma leiin sûnnithlâkin thatin kan um hlak; Berâm that ding anga ngai kan nih,” tia ziek ang khan.

en: Nay, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him that loved us.
hmr: Ṭhe lo e! chuong po poa chun, a mi hmangaitu lei chun ropuitaka hnetu ei nih.

en: For I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor things present, nor things to come, nor powers,
hmr: Chiengtakin ka hriet a nih; thina dâm, hringna dâm, vântirko dâm, inlalna dâm, thil umsa le a la um ding dâm,

en: nor height, nor depth, nor any other creature, shall be able to separate us from the love of God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.
hmr: thilthawtheina dâm, insângna dâm, inthûkna dâm, thilsiem dang hrim hrim khawmin ei Lalpa Krista Isua um Pathien hmangainaa inthawk chun mi ṭhe naw ni.

en: I say the truth in Christ, I lie not, my conscience bearing witness with me in the Holy Spirit,
hmr: Kristaa chun thu taktak ka hril a nih, khêl ka hril nawh, Thlarau Inthieng zâra chun,a ka sie le ṭha hrietna khawmin a mi hrietpui a,

en: that I have great sorrow and unceasing pain in my heart.
hmr: ka lungrila hin rinumna nasatak le lungngaina bo thei naw ka nei in sawnnaw.

en: For I could wish that I myself were anathema from Christ for my brethren’s sake, my kinsmen according to the flesh:
hmr: Ka unauhai, tisa tienga ka chipuihai aiin, kei hi Krista kuoma inthawka ṭhe thlâk khawp hiela thusie phurin um lang ka ti lem a nih,

en: who are Israelites; whose is the adoption, and the glory, and the covenants, and the giving of the law, and the service of God, and the promises;
hmr: Israel mi an ni sih a; nau nina dâm, ropuina dâm, thuthlung po po dâm, Dân pêkna dâm, Pathien rawngbâwlna dâm, thutiemhai po po an ta a nih;

en: whose are the fathers, and of whom is Christ as concerning the flesh, who is over all, God blessed for ever. Amen.
hmr: thlatu bulhai chu an ta a ni bawk a, tisa tieng thuah Krista chu anni laia inthawka hung suok a ni sih a; ama chu thil tinrêng chunga um a na, chatuona inpâk tlâk Pathien a nih. Amen.

en: But it is not as though the word of God hath come to nought. For they are not all Israel, that are of Israel:
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pathien thu chu iengkhawm ni lo anga um ta a ni nawh a. Israelhai chu Israel mi an ni vawng chuong nawh.

en: neither, because they are Abraham’s seed, are they all children: but, In Isaac shall thy seed be called.
hmr: Abraham thlahai an ni leiin an rêngin a nauhai an ni chuong bawk nawh; “Isaka hin i thlahai tîng an tih,” ti a ni lem.

en: That is, it is not the children of the flesh that are children of God; but the children of the promise are reckoned for a seed.
hmr: Chu chu, tisa nauhai chu Pathien nauhai an ni nawh a, thutiem nauhai chu Abraham thlaa ngai an nih tina a nih:

en: For this is a word of promise, According to this season will I come, and Sarah shall have a son.
hmr: Thutiem chu hi hi a nih: “Tu phâ ang hin hung ka ta, Sara chun naupasal nei a tih,” ti hi.

en: And not only so; but Rebecca also having conceived by one, even by our father Isaac—
hmr: Chu chau chu a ni nawh a, Rebeka khawma mi pakhat ei pa Isaka inthawka phîr a vawn lai khan,

en: for the children being not yet born, neither having done anything good or bad, that the purpose of God according to election might stand, not of works, but of him that calleth,
hmr: naute chu an la suok hmaa, a sie le aṭha an la hriet hmain thil thaw lei ni loin,

en: it was said unto her, The elder shall serve the younger.
hmr: a kotu dit lei ni lemin, thlang tieng thua Pathien thu ruot chu a det theina dingin, a kuoma chun, “A upa lemin a naupang lem rawng bâwl a tih,” Pathienin a ti kha.

en: Even as it is written, Jacob I loved, but Esau I hated.
hmr: “Jakob chu ka hmangai a, Esau chu ka theida,” tia ziek ang khan.

en: What shall we say then? Is there unrighteousness with God? God forbid.
hmr: Ieng am hril tâng ei ta? Pathiena chun fel nawna a um am a nih? Teu lo e a!

en: For he saith to Moses, I will have mercy on whom I have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion.
hmr: Ama chun, “Ka lunginsiethai po chu lunginsiet ka ta, zâ ka ngainahai po chunga chun za ngai ka tih,” tiin Mosie kuomah a hril si kha.

en: So then it is not of him that willeth, nor of him that runneth, but of God that hath mercy.
hmr: Chuleiin, a dittu lei a ni nawh a, a hnawttu lei a ni bawk nawh, a lunginsiettu Pathien lei a ni lem a nih.

en: For the scripture saith unto Pharaoh, For this very purpose did I raise thee up, that I might show in thee my power, and that my name might be published abroad in all the earth.
hmr: Pathien Lekha Thuin Pharao kuomah, “Ahi lei ngawt hin ka tungding che a nih, nangmaa chun, ka thilthawtheina kân entir theina ding le khawvêl po poa ka hming ân thang theina dingin,” a ti sih a.

en: So then he hath mercy on whom he will, and whom he will he hardeneth.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pathienin a nuom po a lunginsiet a, a nuom po a suklulul hlak a nih.

en: Thou wilt say then unto me, Why doth he still find fault? For who withstandeth his will?
hmr: Nang chun ka kuomah “Ieng dinga a la dem rawp am a na? A dit zâwng tûin am a kal a?” i ti ding a ni âwm a.

en: Nay but, O man, who art thou that repliest against God? Shall the thing formed say to him that formed it, Why didst thou make me thus?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, aw mihriem, Pathien sêl veitu chu tû ang am i ni lie? Thilsiem chun a siemtu kuomah, “Ieng dinga hieng anga i mi siem am a na?” a ti ding am a nih?

en: Or hath not the potter a right over the clay, from the same lump to make one part a vessel unto honor, and another unto dishonor?
hmr: Bepil tlang khata bêl pakhat hlutak, bêl pakhat hlu nawtaka siem dingin bêl hemtu chun bêl chungah thu a nei naw am a nih?

en: What if God, willing to show his wrath, and to make his power known, endured with much longsuffering vessels of wrath fitted unto destruction:
hmr: Lunginsenna bêl bohmang tlâkhai chunga chun, Pathienin a lunginsenna le a thilthawtheina inlangtir nuom sien khawm, a daw hrâm hrâm chun ieng am pawi a ta?

en: and that he might make known the riches of his glory upon vessels of mercy, which he afore prepared unto glory,
hmr: Lunginsietna bêl, ropui dinga a lo buotsai lâwkhai chunga chun a lunginsietna hau zie ân entir theina ding a ni phawt chun.

en: even us, whom he also called, not from the Jews only, but also from the Gentiles?
hmr: Chu lunginsietna bêlhai chu Judahai lai chau ni loin, Jentailhai laia inthawka kohai khawm ei nih.

en: As he saith also in Hosea, I will call that my people, which was not my people; And her beloved, that was not beloved.
hmr: Hosea lekhabua, “Ka mihai ni ngai lo chu, ‘Ka mihai’ tîng ka ta, Chun, ka ihmangai ngainawnu chu, ‘Hmangainu’ tîng ka tih.

en: And it shall be, that in the place where it was said unto them, Ye are not my people, There shall they be called sons of the living God.
hmr: Chun, hieng hi hung nîng a ta, an kuoma, ‘Ka mihai in ni nawh,’ tia an umna hmun ngeia chun, Pathien hring nauhai inbûkin um an tih,” tia a hril ang ngei khan.

en: And Isaiah crieth concerning Israel, If the number of the children of Israel be as the sand of the sea, it is the remnant that shall be saved:
hmr: Isai khawma Israelhai thu khêkpuiin, “Israel mihai chu tuisuorieta phaiphin zâtin tam hai sien khawm, a ihrem bâk chau chu sandamin um an tih.

en: for the Lord will execute his word upon the earth, finishing it and cutting it short.
hmr: Lalpa chun inrangtakin hnuoi chunga a rorêlna chu a hlen ding a ni sih a,” a ti kha.

en: And, as Isaiah hath said before, Except the Lord of Sabaoth had left us a seed, We had become as Sodom, and had been made like unto Gomorrah.
hmr: Isai bawkin, “Mipuihai Lalpa chun chithlâtu mi lo hlapêk naw sien chu, Sodom angin lo um tâng ei ta, Gomorra anga siemin lo um tâng ei tih,” tia a lo hrillâwk ta ang khan.

en: What shall we say then? That the Gentiles, who followed not after righteousness, attained to righteousness, even the righteousness which is of faith:
hmr: Ieng am hril tâng ei ta? Jentail, felna hnawt nawhai chun felna an lo phâk tah a nih — ringna leia felna chu.

en: but Israel, following after a law of righteousness, did not arrive at that law.
hmr: Israel, felna dân hnawttuhai ruok chun felna dân chu an phâk zo ta nawh.

en: Wherefore? Because they sought it not by faith, but as it were by works. They stumbled at the stone of stumbling;
hmr: Ieng lei am a na? Ringna leh an hnawt nawh a, thilthawa an hnawt lei a nih. Tlûkna lunga chun an tlu ta sih a;

en: even as it is written, Behold, I lay in Zion a stone of stumbling and a rock of offence: And he that believeth on him shall not be put to shame.
hmr: “Ngai ta, Ziona chun Tlûkna lung le, Dangna lungpui ka sie a; Tûkhawm ama ring taphawt chu Muolpho naw ni,” tia ziek ang khan.
